Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 4TravelerQ
Reviews.Content: Booked the room for less than $100 per nite on Hotwire so value was amazing! Parking was $10/park or $32/day for valet service. Internet was $12.95 per day. Restaurant was poor quality for the price for breakfast. Buffet only, for $21.95 per person unless you have kids under 6. Food was good but not worth the price. Lots of great food available outside of the hotel so that is the only meal we ate there. Fitness center , pool, sauna and steam room excellent with great hours. Mall beneath hotel not bad too with food court as well. Great shopping minutes walk away. Chinatown and Old Montreal easy walking distance from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Montreal - good and average”
Reviews.Author: groovy536
Reviews.Content: This hotel has clearly had a huge makeover and the common areas and lobby are quite cool and nice but ultimately there is no getting away from the fact that this is a re branding of what was previously a rather drab large hotel. The room corridors are dark, drab and institutional feeling and the room views in existent or uninspiring at best. The rooms themselves are fine with nice comfortable beds but the bathrooms have not been updated for awhile. Lastly the location is not the smart end of town but it is very central for the Jazz Festival being across the road from the theatre and a short walk to Rue St Denis and St Laurent with some nice restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated but spotty wifi”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Wifi is spotty and below par. I would expect wifi to be seamless in this brand of hotel. Too bad renovations didn't account for new bathroom plumbing. Low water pressure shower and sink- and this is in an upgraded regency room on the top (12th) floor.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Edwina69
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - April 10 & 11, 2012. When you first see the hotel from the outside it is a murky brown building - not much to look at. The moment you step out of the lift this all changes. The bar / lobby and lounge area are decorated to a high standard. Very hip, trendy and modern. All areas were spotlessly clean and plush. Reception check in was very smooth. Our room was spacious and clean. The bathroom had only been re decorated and had beautiful tiles and white fluffy towels. The shower was great and I used the bath also. The bed was large and comortable and we had a large flat screen tv. We had breakfast included with our stay and it was delicious - I could not fault the food, it was fresh and plentiful. We had drinks at the bar which is a huge area with plently of privacy if required. I liked the wine tasting idea and would have tried this if we had more time. The pool area was amazing. There are plenty of loungers and the pool is clean and well kept. You really feel like you are being spoiled here - its such a treat. The hotel is connected to the shopping centre and food courts and metro station. Brilliant location. We walked to Mont Royal Park from the hotel and back within 2 hrs. China town and the Notre Dame are all within easy walking distance. We did take a taxi to Park Olympic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone for a wonderful stay in Montreal for location, friendly staff and a quality hotel. Note: If anyone has the top ten montreal book the hotel location is incorrect on the map. Reception will give you a map and mark the hotel and help you with directions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room”
Reviews.Author: Marcowatty
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on priceline for my stay over the Easter weekend. As my deal was so good, they decided to place me in one of the smaller rooms, which I understand, but which I base my review on. The room had an entrance to 2 doors - one my room and one someone else's (I had to scan my card twice at each door). Inside the room, was a door between my room and the other persons with a lock on it - this creeped me out a little and I felt a little worried about this. An earlier review mentioned the terrible soap and I have to agree (and i've never really had to think about this before). The bed itself was very, very comfy and I liked my hd tv and ipod dock. The common areas of the hotel where very stylish and modern. The staff seemed really busy however and the need to take two elevators was frustrating to say the least. The location was perfect - downtown with underground access to the metro and a big shopping mall. So, the location was good, the room was OK and the elevators were annoying. It's good for the price I got it at, but I would never pay the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Came for the pool”
Reviews.Author: Anita H
Reviews.Content: This was our second time going to the Hyatt . First time , it was excellent . The pool was opened till 10 and opened early, last year . We came especially for the beautiful pool last year and this year . We were coming back to the hotel rushing to make it to the pool before 10 . Around 8:50 we made it to the pool . Not knowing that the pool had changed hours and was only opened till 9 pm . Very dissapointing but , luckily there was still the sauna since the steam room was closed . Very nice sauna and yoga room .... so steam room had broken and was closed , and pool was only opened till 9 . No hot tub in case you are wondering . So we planned to go early tomorrow morning until the friendly lifeguard had told us it was only opened at 1 in the afternoon . Check out time was 12:00 that did not work out and we only made it to the pool once and for only 10 minutes . Meanwhile parking was okay . We got to the underground DesJardins parking and had to pay a pricey amount . Rooms were average but very well maintained and clean. Average size . Bathtub is very small but , location is marvelous right near Catherine Street and across from the art museum . Staff was friendly and the lobby is very nice and modern . The Hyatt may be a little complicated for first timers coming to the hotel since it is inside a huge mall . The Hyatt Regency Hotel is great for families if you are able to go swimming between 1:00 pm and 9 :00 pm I think sauna is open till 10:00 pm . Hopefully they will change their hours . Overall nice and clean hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star with good location, but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: theonlypuckster
Reviews.Content: We mostly enjoyed the Hyatt Regency Montreal. Its location is convenient. Short walks to Old town Montreal, train station & Chinatown. A bit longer of a walk to the shopping on rue St. Denis and the other spots to the North (Schartz deli, Fairmont bagel, McGill, etc). Subway is also close by, but we mostly decided to embrace the cold greyness that was outdoors in Montreal for the duration of the trip. The entrance to the hotel is odd - because the lobby is not on ground level, its multiple elevator rides no matter how you enter/exit from room to outdoors. We were in the city for Wed-Sun of Easter 2012, so maybe that's why the city seemed quiet. We got 2 rooms on priceline. My issue is more with priceline ranking this as a 4 star hotel. There is nothing really 4 star about the hotel. Its clean with a decent selection of tv channels, small bathroom with no natural light and poorly working ventilation fan. The bed left my body a bit achy unless i slept on my back. There was a mini fridge that did a decent enough job of keeping drinks, snacks and desserts cool. It had a small table, 2 chairs, footstool, and desk crammed in a pretty small area. Parking in public garage in mall under hotel was 19/nite during week and 10/nite on weekend. not ideal, but this is a major city, so not unreasonable either. I would stay here again, but would probably try to get it even lower then the 100/nite i paid. Not sure if I enjoyed Montreal enough to return, but if I do, i would be ok with staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Justwayne63
Reviews.Content: This building dates back to 1976 and it looks like the hotel was not renovated since. It has a dated feel. The lobby is not at street level, which means you have to go up one floor to reach it, then go to a different elevator to reach the other floors. A waste of time and something that could have been designed differently. I heard other guests complain about this. The room itself was fine. Large enough, so-so bed, nice furniture. I think it's everything else that needs updating (lobby, elevators, corridors, common areas). The service is pleasant, but the staff always seems overworked. I phoned reception and had to hang up after 10 rings. Little detail: the soaps and shampoos are by far the worst and most awful-smelling things I've been in contact with in a hotel. Absolutely gross. I stayed at the Montreal Novotel-Centre recently and thought it was a far superior hotel, even if it doesn't have a pool. I will not go back to the Hyatt. Too bad, because the location is fantastic, especially during the Jazz Festival.

Reviews.Title: “An improvement from my prior visit”
Reviews.Author: gasman1165
Reviews.Content: The physical aspect of the property remains unchanged, however the staff appeared to be more friendly and attentive. The front desk attendant named Maria was exemplary and the epitome of what every hotel should benchmark as an ideal employee.

Reviews.Title: “Great service ! Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: quebectraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We went o the Hyatt and were really treated well by all the staff. Indoor pool is great and the hotel is in a mall so you can shop and eat inside! Only drawback is the 35$ a day parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hyatt Regency Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lola1755
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly suitable, clean and the location is great. Staff are very helpful, polite and courteous. The pool, gym and spa are fantastic. Rooms are simple,very clean and comfortable. The concierges are fabulous. Underground parking is offered at $10 per 'enter', so you're better off parking for the weekend and using your feet or a cab. You may get your parking validated by some of the restaurants in the surrounding area (i.e. $25 at Mike's will get you free parking for that day). The pool and inside/outside deck are great. My favorite spot in the entire hotel. I`m planning on staying here again in June!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hans M
Reviews.Content: Nice hÃ´tel with great location, friendly staff, rooms a bit outdated, we had a great view of the city from our room facing west. during the nignt sleep was average, we could hear a bit of street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great bed”
Reviews.Author: JonMontreal
Reviews.Content: I always find Hyatt's to be of good quality. The hotel lobby looked great. It had a great view out the window from our room. The rooms themselves are getting dated, and so are the bathrooms. The bed, in usual Hyatt style, was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great location and dated room”
Reviews.Author: melbcollege
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for 4 days. booking and online check in was so easy. arrived really late (around 10 pm) staff are really warm and welcoming. moved me to higher floor on my request. very comfortable bed, good size room, bathroom is a little bit dated. I discovered in room safe box is not working. Staff fixed it really quickly on second day. Bar staff are really friendly and helpful as well. I try to have my dinner before they close 11 pm, they have problem takes my order and bring out a beautiful burger for me. hotel is located in the heart of Montreal. very easy to walk to major shopping area, old montreal is only 5-10 walk away. I also walked to Mount Royal, it was fantastic. Took me around to get there but worth every effort. Hotel is part of shopping complex, there are heaps of food outlets in the food court, a lot of shops as well. I had breakfast at these coffee shops at food court, it is really good and relatively cheap. check out again was really pleasant, i have to leave hotel around 5,30 am, staff was really friendly and professional in early morning. I was really impressed. all in all it was really pleasant stay at this hotel for my first trip to Montreal, I will definitely go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dimitroff1
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in the past 4 months that we have stayed at the Hyatt Montreal. The first time was only for one night but this time we stayed for three days and it was just as good or better then the last time. Room are very modern and clean and everyone was very helpful. The hotel is so close to everything, ie: shopping, sports, food and arts, I don't think we would stay at any other hotel when staying in Montreal. You can access the Metro without even going outdoors which is great for the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best LOCATED Hotel in Montreal !”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: Pros: Courteous staff at the Lobby. Self check out process is quick and easy. Rooms are clean, quiet and modern. Hotel is WELL located. You can get about anywhere in downtown for less than a 15$ Taxi ride. Hotel is adjacent to a BIG food Court. Hotel is adjacent to a shopping center. Cons: Elevators are really slow. Lobby renovations were noisy. Lobby is way too busy. Prices vary a lot depending the season (can be OverPriced at some moment) Traveled for business / conferences. Appreciated this Hotel. Will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our new base of operations in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl830
Reviews.Content: After around 20 stays in Montreal over the last 3 years, we tried the Hyatt for the first time and loved it. It won us over with location, great breakfast, and wonderful common areas, such as the self-service wine bar, and a lovely pool, that we want to explore further on our next trip. Check-in was a breeze, room was very nice and it was so easy to go to the lower level to the underground shopping center, or a few steps to St. Catherine's; wonderful as the Festival of Lights was right there at Place d'Arts. It is easily walkable to Old Montreal, or to the main thoroughfares of Sherbrook, St. Laurent, etc. Also, on the weekend, you can self-park downstairs for $10, which we have not experienced, usually paying $20-25 for our overnight self parking at other hotels. This is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, mostly average.”
Reviews.Author: Will58
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt property is in an excellent location in Montreal - close to some great museums and easy walking distance of Old Montreal. The lobby has been updated and has the cool/funky vibe the Regency brand is going for. However, when I stayed the hotel was busy and the wait for the elevator was unacceptable - sometimes close to 10 minutes. The rooms have also been updated and mine was large and comfortable - the hallways have not and are dim and old. Service was average. The check-in was painless, but I felt like the person helping me was just going through the motions with yet another guest. At breakfast, there weren't enough staff on-hand for a busy Saturday morning and it took ages to get someone's attention. The breakfast buffet was pretty average too - soggy eggs, a few sides, bread and cereal. They need to liven it up a bit. My advice is if you can get a good price here then its worth it. If not, look for something a little more interesting and with better attention to service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, super stylin'”
Reviews.Author: KaseyR
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in February here with some friends. The location was PERFECT, right by Ste. Catherine St and the subway as well. The parking lot is underground, and (self-parking) $19/day, but once we parked, I didn't have to move the car all weekend - that's a big plus. The lobby and wine bar area are really comfortably and super stylish, I must have spent the most time I ever had just hanging out by the fireplace with some wine from the (very cool) self-serve wine bar - you have to see it! The staff are SO friendly, and the hotel is attached to an underground mall - easy access to early morning coffee and a bite to eat without needing a coat :) The room was great, comfy beds, nice bathroom, and great view of the festival going on right outside! I'd recommend this hotel for sure, a great spot for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cbrunet_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend during the Montreal en Lumiere festival, and the location was pretty much perfect. Located a short walk from Old Montreal and right on Ste Catherine, it is a good starting point for a weekend in Montreal. The room itself was okay - kind of small and a bit dated, but we just used it as a home base as the purpose of our trip was not to hang out in the hotel room all weekend. For that purpose, it was fine (especially since we got a smokin deal on priceline). It's a bit of an adventure to find the hotel lobby, and it's definitely not luxury accommodations, but no real complaints here. A decent room in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: chemmie
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights during icy cold February, and had a wonderful stay. There are a couple areas (hallway walls and carpets) where the hotel could use a little TLC, but it is still very nice and clean. Service was exceptionally friendly, the bed was comfortable, and the location is perfect. One block away is a metro stop that can get you anywhere. About two blocks in the other direction is another metro stop, for a different line. 5-10 minutes walk to Old Montreal, and the Notre Dame Cathedral. There is a Starbucks directly across the street for free internet and coffee. Downstairs, in the mall, is a drug store and mall food court for quick snacking. Two blocks away is Benelux, a small brewery making great beer. Really, it couldn't be any more convenient. Downstairs, by the pool, the hotel has an amazing gym and spa. The spa area has a nice steam room and sauna, free for hotel guests. I found myself going down to the spa for a steam, and to shower, with a nice large rain shower head, instead of using my room. Exceptionally nice and relaxing. Service was very friendly, especially our maid, Lise (or Lisa.) We kept the "Do Not Disturb" sign up every day but one, and she went out of her way to catch us in the hallway to see if we needed anything. Incredibly nice, and cleaned our room spotlessly on the day we didn't have the sign up. Overall, minus the noticeable wear on the walls and carpet in the hallway, I have nothing to complain about. I had a great 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Close to St Catherine Street”
Reviews.Author: northknight3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is built into the corner of Desjardins Complex fast food and shopping Center, on the corner of St Catherine Street and Rue Jeanne Mance which is the main downtown street for things going on in Montreal, like city shows and concets are just across the street (but mainly in the summer) there is the Theatre Maissonneuve and L'OpÃ©ra de MontrÃ©al 1 minute walk. Valet parking is $30 + tax with in/out privileges. My room was clean but this hotel is looking tried, carpets over used, and in need of a refubish. Small things didn't work, like the hair dryer, I also had to get the batteries replace in the TV remote, example: downstairs next to the front desk is an automated self serve wine bar with a very inviting large gas fire place to sit and enjoy with a glass of wine, however the automated wine bar was not working and only the bar service was available. I found the staff friendly and very helpful with local directions. All the rooms start at about the third or forth floor and go up so you get a city veiw no matter what room you get. The breakfast is buffet $21 run-of-the-mill fare but acceptable. The hotel is close to Chinatown but not much of a Chinatown in Montreal, old Montreal is a brisk 15 minute walk away, subway within 2 minutes walk. Good all round location, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Angela K
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for one night in January just for a quick get-away and we were very happy with our our stay. Room was very clean and bed was super comfortable. Pretty average room amentities (ie. ipod doc, coffee maker, safe, mini fridge, flat screen tv). The bathroom was clean (small - but clean), but lacking on the towels although I am sure if I called housekeeping they would have brought up extra's without an issue. The front desk staff were very polite and helpful. Pool area was really nice and clean but we did not swim so can't comment on the pool temperature. Really nice up to date gym. The hotel has a really interesting 'serve yourself' wine bar/lounge. You purchase wine cards at the front desk and 'help yourself' to various international wines (prices range from $3.00 a 1/8 glass to $23.00 a 1/2 glass). You can sit and sip by a fireplace and the wine bar area also has free wifi. NOTE: There is no free wifi in the rooms but if you travel frequently you'll know that most of the 'upper' levels of hotels (3.5 stars and up) don't offer free wifi anyways. All of the public areas in the hotel offered free wifi and the hotel has quite a few public/lounge areas so it wasnt an issue. Husband and I enjoyed the bar area and the decor was really nice/modern - bartenders were friendly as well. The hotel is connected to a shopping mall and it was $10.00/24 hours (no in/out priviledges) on the weekend if you parked at the underground mall parking. The hotel is within walking distance to Old Montreal and the water (15-20 minute walk). I can't comment on the hotel food/restaurant as as we walked down to Old Montreal and enjoyed dinner at one of the restaurants there. Enjoyed our stay, and would stay again. Found nothing bad to say or even negative points to mention. Ended up getting a really good price using Hotwire so that was even better. Please note the pictures ... the room is actually nicer than the pictures show.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay over MLK weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ziggarelli D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montreal Hyatt for a long holiday weekend. We were very happy with our our stay. The furniture in our room was modern and there were robes, extra pillows, blankets, plenty of nice-quality toiletries. The bed was very comfortable, and the ipod/radio in the room was easy to use and good sound quality. The pod coffee makers in the rooms allowing us to make one fresh cup at a time were appreciated. The staff we interacted with were excellent. We did not see any issues with room service trays in the halls, all public spaces were neat and clean. We ate in the restaurant, and the decor is very dramatic, there are 3 fireplaces you can sit at, and there is a nice pool at the ground level. Our room rate was excellent and was better than the similar quality hotels in the area. We ate in the restaurant because it was so cold outside. The food was prepared well and the presentation was excellent. Our waitress was also a bartender and she monitored our drinks perfectly, and brought us extra snacks, even after dinner when we were done and sitting in the bar. The restaurant and bar area has elaborate decor, with cool furniture groupings and elaborate interior design. The hotel is connected to the underground city so it is possible to connect from amtrak to the hotel without going outside, and to visit many parts of the downtown while remaining indoors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: AnHedgehog
Reviews.Content: We went there two times at the end of 2011, one night mid December, one night end of December. The room was nice, but the breakfast was so bad, regarding both the service and the poor quality of the food, that we changed our second reservation after the first stay, from a breakfast inclusive package to a night only package, and we had our breakfast to another hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great winter hotel - leave your coat in your room!”
Reviews.Author: lindak74
Reviews.Content: The #1 best feature of this hotel is the fact that it's connected to the underground. Within a 2-minute indoor walk, you can access a pharmacy, a food court, a liquor store. Notre Dame Cathedral is about 10 minutes of indoor walk followed by maybe 2 minutes of outdoor walking. The subway system is also accessible via the underground path system. LOVED IT. As for the hotel itself, the lobby and lounge are very chic, and the rooms have been renovated but just enough to make them look more modern. It's fine, but don't expect to be blown away by the beauty of your room. During our stay, we had a flooding problem because guests in the room above us left their water running all day. When we came back in the afternoon one day, we had a puddle in the bathroom, a drip in the closet, and a giant patch of carpet between the hallway and the first bed was soaked. Maintenance responded very quickly and was really nice about it. However, we were surprised that we weren't offered the chance to move to a different (dry) room. We talked about it and decided not to request it, since packing up and moving on our last night would be a pain, but I can't help but think that in a different hotel, the hotel would have extended the offer as a courtesy instead of leaving us in a room where we had to keep our shoes on in our room for the rest of our stay. That was really my only issue with this hotel. By the way, we had dinner one night in the hotel lounge and the food was quite tasty!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PacoO
Reviews.Content: A good hotel ideally located. You have access downstairs to the 'underground city' and the subway - especially useful when it is cold out. The hotel is on one of the main streets in town so you are close to all the action - our room overlooked the Place des Arts - where in summer there is always something going on. The room was a decent size although the bathroom is a bit on the small side. The hotel has an excellent pool but with lots of kids around. There is a nice lounge area by the pool as well to relax after using the pool. The sauna is one of the better ones I've used but is small. Parking is very reasonable as well, I believe it was $14 for 24 hours on a weekend. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sony406
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in Montreal, close to Place des Arts and the Orchestra house. Service has improved a lot since Hyatt took over the place. And the price is competitive, at least in the winter time. Located in the eastern part of the city where french is predominant. Large public place available downstairs with restaurants, shops etc. Essential in the winter time. Short walk inside to get to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par!”
Reviews.Author: Francine B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the center of MontrÃ©al and there is no possibility to make a reservation in French. I asked for a French receptionist. I waited 15 minutes. An interpreter was finally found but as soon as she tried to translate my request the line was cut off. So I made my reservation using the Internet English Site. We had confirmation a month in advance for a non-smoking room with a king size bed. Upon arrival on January 1, 2012 we were told that they had no more rooms with king size bed. We were given a non-smoking room on the 6th floor. The hallway on the 6th floor was covered with white towels. Someone had vomited and the vomiting was still all over the carpet. We walked on this to get to our room. This room had definitely been used by very heavy smokers. The cigarette smell was intolerable for a non-smoker. We returned to the front desk and ask for another room. We were first told that this was the only room available. But when we firmly insisted, the employee went away and came back with another room on the 7th floor. This was much better, still no king size bed. We do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: dean16000
Reviews.Content: Why do you have to charge for internet? $15 a day, really? I used it for three days, that came to $45 that's more than a month for FIOS Internet. Next time I will be staying at Holiday Inn, free internet, and free breakfast. Hotel was very clean, service was good, I just wish they never charged for the internet. My suggestion would be using the laptop at Starbucks or McDonalds for free internet. Room service was quick but pricy; I paid $35 for a hamburger and fries :-( Gym is nice and big for a hotel, the pool was nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lizirizea
Reviews.Content: The Room was very Clean when we checked in. We went to Montreal to wander around the city so we didn't really stay inside the room! Room Service was quick and we got everything we needed. The location is one of the best thing about this hotel! Walking is part of our lives so for us it was a very quick walk to Basilica Notre-Dame and Old Montreal which i think the nicest place in Montreal. Will i stay at this place again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice--bed sheets were full of hair”
Reviews.Author: ENMcK
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the price was right, the new lobby is nice, the rooms are average, and the baths are well below par. But we checked are beds when we arrived and was surprised to discover that the sheets on both beds were full of hair. We asked for new sheets and the person just handed a stack for us to do ourselves. Comparing the new sheets to the old, they clearly weren't changed. Kind of a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly let down...”
Reviews.Author: MrWiz1
Reviews.Content: When you select Hyatt, you expect an upper end hotel...not this one for me...shame as i'm a Hyatt passport /points man..Admittedly the bar and restaurant area has been modernised, but the rooms are a little tired and my AC didn't work great,73f blowing out cold when it was 27f outside... The entrance doesn't flow well being above a shopping mall, park on one level, up one elevator, check in(once you find reception), then another elevator around a corner to your rooms....litle clunky. Location is ok, can't say much else, wasn't there long enough. If you like indoor shopping then the mall is down one elevator, jus make sure you get the right elevator and the right floor...think I'll stay elsewhere next time...sorry Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bk-mom
Reviews.Content: We had my son's wedding here in Nov, 2011. We couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel has had a major renovation and it shows. The lobby area, bar, Regency club, and banquet facilities are terrific. The rooms are fine, big enough although the bathrooms are pretty small. The staff was execeptionall good- nothing was a "problem". The location is great. Doing a Regency upgrade was well worth it for the included breakfasts and snacks, and drinks. Thanks, Hyatt Regency, for a wonderful stay and experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in downtown Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a romantic weekend away. Won this hotel through Priceline (bid 4-star in Old Montreal). Location is convenient and provides walking distance to plenty of shops and restaurants. The hotel is located above a very small shopping mall. Although I found the 5th floor lobby strange, I did enjoy the 2nd floor food court! The lobby is not very welcoming and does not promote anyone to lounge around. Unfortunately, this is the only area for free WiFi within the hotel. Luckily, the 2nd floor food court also provides free WiFi... So you can check email over a cheap meal. Close by is also a performance theatre, and plenty of restaurants to pick from. Rooms within the hotel are spacious but bathrooms are small. Parking is expensive at $20/day but what can you expect for downtown Montreal. A grocery store within the mall provides easy access to food if needed. Overall, a convenient location for no fuss travelers looking for a relaxing get-away. Unfortunately, nothing stood out that made this hotel exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “looks good from the outside but...”
Reviews.Author: El_Buritto
Reviews.Content: Hyatt is my hotel chain of choice, I use them heavily because I appreciate quality and enjoy the reward points. At this particular hotel, they are going through renovations so it looks good from the outside, lobby and the new bar area. The room however was shabby, there was a hole in the wall, the room appreared heavily used and worse of all, my bed smelled like someone else had just slept in it. I was too tired to complain and change rooms so I slept on top of the covers. I was coming back into town for business in Valcourt and picked a different hotel...too bad

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but old hotel that is in need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: SanJose023
Reviews.Content: It's a very convenient location, but rooms are old. Washrooms are outdated and looked like bathrooms from the 80's. Rooms are dark and small as well. For the price paid to be in a central location, it is fairly reasonable. Hotel is in real need of renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan1980
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a recent weekend at the Hyatt Regency in Montreal, Quebec. This is my third time staying there and I can find no major fault with the hotel. Location is absolutely the best. You are a short walk to Old Montreal and right on St. Catherine Street so you are near everything. There is a mini shopping area underneath the hotel along with a grocery store and SAQ as well as a food court and restaurants that are attached to the hotel as well so that you don't have to go outside to eat if you don't want to. One minor complaint I have about this stay was about the overall cleanliness of the hotel. which for the most part was good, however, there were room service trays in the hallway all day along with one room that had several wine glasses on the floor outside for almost 2 days. It wouldn't hurt to send someone around to the floors periodically and pick these things up. One other minor complaint is about the buffet breakfast, while very plentiful. was cold most mornings. The usual scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, etc. but it was barely lukewarm. One bit of advice, if you partake in breakfast at the hotel, use the omelette station - at least those eggs will be hot. This hotel has recently renovated the main lobby area which is quite nice, very contemporary but does not give you the warm welcoming feeling - rather cold and stark. Overall, the hotel is a great place to stay for location - it is clean for the most part and I would stay again and recommend it to friends, along with my suggestions for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard but watch out for the breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: The hotel was about average for Hyatt Regencies. The TV was one of the first I have experienced in hotels that actually broadcast HD programs in HD on the HD capable TV's. But watch out for the breakfasts. They are $25 each no matter what one eats. One might be advised to consider the Starbuck's directly across the street. The area around the bar has free WiFi internet. The rooms offer in-room coffee makers, which is always nice. My colleague used the exercise facility and said there weren't nearly enough treadmills at 6AM.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt in Montreal- C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: CoupleWhoTravel
Reviews.Content: We were here for a 3 day conference. The hotel was very centrally located and a short drive from the airport ($30 taxi fare). There is shopping and a food court right where the hotel is (all indoor). A short walk (5-10 mins) gets to the core shopping area, a 15 min walk brings you to Old Montreal (a European feel with cobblestone roads and beautiful architecture). A romantic horse carriage ride along the waterfront if you are so inclined. More unique shopping finds in old Montreal (boutiques with the latest European styles). Lots of food selection. Don't miss the Montreal style bagels (Fairmount Bagels is the best)- about 30-40 min walk (if you don't like to walk, take a cab) and Schwartz's Deli is slightly closer, but still 30 min walk (or take a cab)- go for the smoked meat sandwich (there is fat, medium or lean). Recommend medium as you only live once. Poutine is another must if you haven't had before (Fries, gravy and cheese curds). Hotel was good; however, not as updated as what we typically expect from the Hyatt chain- but definitely good, clean and can't beat the location. We had a late flight and hotel accommodated a late check out without any fuss. Very friendly service. Business Centre open to guests to print out plane e-tickets was very convenient. If you are going for the first time or for a short time...have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Expected A Better Experience”
Reviews.Author: brymat
Reviews.Content: A dated hotel, aside from the room TV. Upgraded to a Recency Club room and it was very disappointing. Web site stated upgraded bath amenities including Aquafresh Extreme toothpaste products - but there were none. I had to ask the front desk for toothpaste, they brought me up two small travel Crest tubes in a used plastic bag! Also states "secured access" top floors, 18 years of age and older. NOT - nothing secure about the floor access and baby stroller in the hall. They state evening hor d'oeuvres and cocktails in the Regency Club is also included - yet they charge you for the cocktails. So that's not really included, it is?? Bit of false advertising in my opinion. No room service after midnight was surprising as was the fact that they close their pool for cleaning in the middle of a Saturday afternoon. Strange time to clean a pool. Coffee in the room was not replenished on Saturday so Sunday morning I had to find a cleaning lady to get more coffee. Finally, the wine glasses we used on Friday night and placed in the hallway outside our door are still sitting there right now, Sunday morning. People were nice, location very good - but overall a bad experience for what I had expected to be a first class weekend with the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Would be a 5 if they didn't charge for wi fi”
Reviews.Author: Med_LoverOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Rooms, service, location all great, but there were a few cost cutting measures I thought inappropriate at the price. Little: only three single cup sachets of coffee per day for two people, though they gave more if you asked at the desk. Bigger: I have stayed at 7 hotels in three countries in the last year, and this is the only one that charged for wi fi - a whopping 13.99 per day. That is definitely behind the times. Fortunately I had some data on my plan at home to use up, but for international travelers, or those without mobile data plans in Canada, it amounts to an extra room charge. Hint: there is free wi fi in the Food Court of the mall downstairs and Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dimitroff1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in November and it was perfect for what we were visiting Montreal. It was close to everything, ie: shopping and Old Montreal, walking distanc to both. I would say that this hotel would work for any type of traveler. Rooms were great, and interior of hotel was very modern.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to All”
Reviews.Author: hcarlock66
Reviews.Content: Visited Montreal for a NASCAR Race in Aug 2011. My 1st time in the city. The Hotel was perfectly located across the street to one of the many Underground Malls and a Subway Station. There are several great restaurants within walking distance from the Hotel. Bicycle Rentals were abundant within short walking distance from the Hotel. The Hotel has a modern vibe to it, the room was spacious and had a great view, at least from our side, that overlooked the city. There was a Film Festival going on during our visit that the Hotel seemed to be the Host Hotel of the event, despite this the staff was very pleasant, maintaining a clean common area and room. The only downside I guess I could make was the price of parking our car. They charge a daily rate despite staying at the Hotel. Overall I was very pleased with the Hotel and plan on using the hotel when I visit Montreal again...

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad”
Reviews.Author: jkearse42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my immigration interview for my wife and son. Obviously price was steep. Service was nice, not a French speaker but still friendly for once. The Desjardians was nice with its waterfall, pretty neat. Rooms were decent size, beds were comfortable. Had a nice view of city

Reviews.Title: “Everything good except charge for wireless”
Reviews.Author: Med_loverCanada
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, good service, convenient location, room service breakfast better value than most hotels of this type, but it's getting more and more unusual to charge for Wi fi. However, it's free in the food court in the mall downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable stay, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: traveler2009Illinois
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt while attending a conference in Montreal. The location is terrific - across from the Contemporary arts center, above the indoor mall, a short walk from the old town and chinatown and not far from the museums and McGill. Typical Hyatt room-nice bed and linens, small but well equipped bathroom, good tv--although few channels in English. I used room service and it was fast and efficient. Nothing spectacular,but pleasant, serviceable and all one would expect from a Hyatt. The concierge was actually very helpful and the staff at the front desk were good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Talisker55
Reviews.Content: For a short business stay in downtown Montreal this is your hotel. Centrally located to everything, including a short walk to Dunn's and Schwartz's (which are mandatory when visiting Montreal). Rooms are clean, spaceous and well appointed. The food in the Saveur restaurant is excellent while the drink selection in Six Resto Lounge is passable (the french still believe that Chivas and Johnnie Walker actually qualify as Scotch!)

Reviews.Title: “The pictures dont lie”
Reviews.Author: doubleR32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov.11-13 for a weekend in Montreal and it was all you can ask for. The Hotel is top noch and has everything you need. A beautiful bar loug (classy) and well decorated. The location of this hotel is also prime if you are looking to walk down St.Catherin's or take the Metro. The best part about the place is that you can find an eggspectation right next to it for breakfast! No need to walk outside as it is attached to the hotel. Free local calls and internet as well is included with your stay but is you call long distance you will get dinged hard. I would stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Montreal and would recomened it to everyone else. Its worth paying the extra bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great restaurant, rooms need an update!”
Reviews.Author: Sgrayg
Reviews.Content: Great location for the conference center, especially walking underground through the connecting walkways. The restaurant, both food and service is excellent, however, the rooms and even elevator are in need of an upgrade. The elevator is almost a theme ride with the decent. Take the elevator from near the restaurant down to the food court for hot chocolate and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: benjih12
Reviews.Content: Great location, stayed for 1 night before driving to Boston. Staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spaceous. Restaurants and bars right on the door step, but hotel is not noisy or effected by this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csmslc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in June during a french music festival. Loved the music, location, room and atmosphere. Great food in hotel and in Montreal. Walked to the convention center, above ground or underground when it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes the hotel”
Reviews.Author: meljup
Reviews.Content: I had a good impression of this hotel the moment we checked in where I was greeted with the best service of my North American trip. The reception staff welcomed us with open arms, gave my kids a little gift each and set a wonderful tone for the stay. The rooms were a little dated, but immaculate. The housekeepers were the most efficient I had encountered. They even left a thank you note for the tip !. The pool area is fabulous, a great place to unwind and watch the city underneath. My only complaint was how the hotel was overwhelmed by people that weren't guests, who crowded the balcony for the Arcade fire concert. It would have been nice for guests to have priority in the hotel areas that night, and the lifts were overwhelmed a little with people coming into the hotel from the shopping area. It was also a little worrying to have so many people coming into the hotel unchecked. Other than that, we had a fabulous stay, the location is fantastic. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “no surprises”
Reviews.Author: restleswanderer
Reviews.Content: great service, fast check in, great rooms , great breakfast. A bit expensive to park your car.Right next to the jazz festival location , very nice to be able to step out the door and be there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kraver
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel once previously. When reviewing it back then, the one thing I made mention of was that the interior of the rooms were very disappointing for a hotel of this caliber. Well, they must have renovated the interiors since because on this visit I found the interiors very nice. Overall the hotel externally, hallways, lobby, etc... was always nice but now with the rooms fixed up, it is pretty much perfect. The location cannot be beat. Lots of restaurants nearby. A great square/gathering place right across from the hotel. Underneath the hotel is a mall with a food court and a grocery store - very convenient. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Needs Maintenace”
Reviews.Author: BKF59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Hotel in downtown Montreal for one night after finishing a cruise in October. Overall the hotel is nice and a perfect location. I was just disappointed to find that the tile in our bathroom floor was all cracked plus the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off the wall. For the amount of money we paid to stay here through our cruise line, the room should of been perfect. Also WIFI was $15 a day to hook up to plus the hotel did not provide a shuttle to anyplace. The mall underneath has great pastry places for breakfast which was a plus as no free breakfast at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: septemberfalls
Reviews.Content: This is a sleek, modern Hyatt in a really central location. The lobby has a nice bar and restaurant, and is located on top of a mall and food court, In addition, you can walk outside and will be surrounded by blocks and blocks of shopping and restaurants. It's a solid Hyatt hotel - decent bed/linen/decor/bathroom, clean, and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: NEFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I always expect more out of Hyatt and think of this chain as a four star hotel. I would say this one was three star. What it appears they did was a facelift as noted in other reviews, but they didn't correct issues before adding beautiful decor. In our room we had wonderful bedding and nice furniture. But the bathroom had mold throughout the tile and the ceiling literally had the paint peeling off. In the main part of our room there was wallpaper coming off the wall. The service was very good and the employees helpful and accomodating in all areas. The bright purple colors and the bold furniture is not my taste, but may appeal to others. Valet parking was $19 per day, but the service they provided was very good. We really liked the area the hotel was in. Easy walking to the water area, Notre Dame and access to the underground city area which was very unique and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Old Quebec and downtown”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaGoldwing
Reviews.Content: This was a great place, although a bit over-priced. It is close to everything. European bakery underneath the hotel with French Pastries to die for. There was coffee in the room. We had a view of the roof and some flags off in the distance, but not much else. Hotel people were helpful. You could walk to old Montreal, Notre Dame cathedral and that area quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “They Try Very Hard”
Reviews.Author: Freese
Reviews.Content: Well, first of the staff is very helpfull. When you check in they are polite, courteous and they have all the information. We were told where to go and what was going on. Now for the real review...dun dun dun..... The hotel tries very hard. They have done quite a few renovations both to the common areas and the rooms. A very average room in an average hotel. Things that stick out. 12.95 for internet. No complementary breakfast. The breakfast buffet is 21.95. Valet parking is $30. The mall attached to the hotel is BOSS. Don't want to pay $30 for a burger, go to the IGA downstairs and get some food. SAQ is downstairs too for booze. Location. This hotel is right on the edge of the...not so good area. Go a few blocks east and it's nothing but rock bars and seedy looking people. If this is your thing, great. But for a family....not so much. You have to walk a bit to get to Peel and Ontario street but it's not far or a short cab ride if you're lazy. I recommend Jello Bar. As for late night stuff. Getting sick and woke up around 1am. Snuck out of the room around 1:30am. The hotel bar was done for the night. Outside everything was locked up tight. Nothing open. Don't stray to far...remember, nothing good happens at 1:30am. All in all it's a decent place but for 179 smackeroonies you'd think they'd toss in a freebee or 2. Photos to come later of the off centre shower. It's hilarious.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Altimatic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Montreal this past weekend. I was in town to check out Importfest at Place Bonaventure. The hotel is conveniently located less than 10 minutes away by car to the event. Its close to the Central station if you are taking a Via rail train or to the Bus station for bus riders (also approx. 10 mins to either one). The staff was very nice and courteous. I'm a little shocked by some negative reviews by other reviewers as it is totally opposite to my experience. The hotel is well maintained. The room is very clean. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby. Comfort I've come to expect and get used to with Hyatt Hotels. For those who can't live without their coffee, there is a Starbucks across the street from the hotel. There is a mall connected under the hotel. Within the mall is a Budget car rental location for those preferring to drive around. The typical rack rate of $199 is a bit pricey for this hotel. I managed to book my stay through pricline.com for $90 a night. I certainly would stay at this hotel again and would not hesitate to recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not for the standard price”
Reviews.Author: leemoreau
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one night stay at the Hyatt in Montreal. I used Priceline so I got it for $105 when it said regularly it was $200 or so. The hotel is very nice, but I'd have been disappointed if I paid $200 for it. The location is great, it's right at Complex Desjardins so you don't even have to go outside to get to Eaton Centre etc. My issue is that I found the hotel actually hard to find as the lobby is really on something like the 5th or the 10th floor. You have to take an elevator from the ground up to the lobby or Foyer level, but there's no signs or anything telling you this. I saw the elevators but there was no sign that said Hyatt or anything so I assumed they were for something else and spent about 15 minutes trying to find the lobby until I finally asked the valet where to go who told me to take that elevator one floor up. Once you're in the lobby it's very nice but you then have to take more elevators up to the room which is a bit odd as it's a lot of elevators to get to your room but not the end of the world. The room was nice, I had a King size bed but there was nothing overly fancy with it. It was very dark as they all have really small windows and even with the curtains pulled open it was still very dark. I had all the lamps on and still found it a bit dreary compared to other hotels I've been at. Other than that the hotel is really nice but nothing that made me say wow or anything like that. I definitely would have felt a bit ripped off if I had paid any more than $150 or so for it. Also Internet isn't free, I can't remember how much but in the $13 range or so per day.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Montreal, adequate but not a stand-out”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Cain
Reviews.Content: Checked in for one night on a business trip, arriving by cab. It seems soul-less with little or no character, but perhaps I just hated the decor. Elevator to the lobby, then different elevators to the rooms. The room was average for the price, seemed small and in fact I thought a little pricey for what it was. The sealed window unit was obviously failed as it was steamed up between the panes so the view, such as it was, was pretty much obscured. It was a Monday night so I guess you wouldn't expect it to be hopping entertainment-wise. That said, the staff were helpful, friendly and efficient. Needed a late checkout, asked for one, and got it. Still can't understand why Hyatt thinks it needs to charge for internet when even a Best Western can do it for free (note that if you stay at Hyatt hotels frequently their loyalty program rewards you with free internet) Location is good - right next to the Place des Arts on St Catherine Street with the adjacent mall. Probably won't stay at this particular Hyatt again unless there is a good reason, but would not tell people to avoid it. As I said, adequate, but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline for a 4-night stay in August. I was looking forward to my trip as I had booked a supposedly "4-star" hotel for what would have been a great price-- $80/night, which after taxes and fees, worked out to more like $95/night. The lobby and common areas are nice enough, although not really extraordinarily nice. It was a bit weird that from the street, you have to take an elevator up to the lobby, and then another elevator up to your room. I was on the first floor, but yet I had to take the elevator up to my room, as there was no accessible set of stairs to walk up the one flight to my room. Not that I really wanted to go to my room, as it was terrible. I've stayed in motels that have been nicer. The bed and pillows were not really terribly comfortable. The furniture and decor was extremely drab. Not what I would have expected from a "4-star" hotel. In addition, it felt like I was being nickel-and-dimed my entire stay. Internet service? $14 a night! I felt compelled to call the front desk and say how absurd that was, and the gentleman I spoke to was flat out rude to me, saying I "was wrong" and it was the "policy of the hotel." I replied that it was a bad policy, and he replied, "No." Never has someone been so rude to me at an establishment supposedly of that caliber. I payed for the internet for two nights before I realized that the Starbucks across the street from the hotel had an open WiFi network. In addition, halfway through my stay I needed a refrigerator, which my room did not have. I requested one through the front desk and they wanted to charge me $25 for such a basic amenity. I had a friend staying at a REAL 4-star hotel a couple of blocks away, and she had a fridge, free internet, a lavishly appointed room, beautiful common areas and a very comfortable bed. The difference was night and day. I will never stay here again, even at $80 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Emily J
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. We were on our honeymoon - which usually when you tell people that you get slightly better service. Not here! When we first arrived just after our 3pm check in time we were told that our room was not ready and to come back 45 minutes to and hour. We werenâ€™t thrilled but we didnâ€™t see much choice so we wandered around the attached shopping center and came back an hour later. We were told that our room had been given away. My husband told the desk clerk that was unacceptable and after some discussion they found us a room. We went up to our room and right away we were unimpressed. The room was not nice. The window was SO dirty that we could hardly see out of it. The bathroom floor was dirty. The bathroom was dark and cramped. Overall the look and feel of the room was unpleasant. My husband went downstairs to talk to the concierge about a place to have dinner. The person at the concierge desk turned and walked away when my husband walked towards him. Even when my husband called after him he was ignored. The hallways were constantly filled with unattended cleaning carts. They were not in used and not pushed to the side. It was very unprofessional. Food that was left from room service was left for a full day sitting in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt's Lowest”
Reviews.Author: travelingbuddyMaine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip with a large group that had made reservations a year in advance. We had requested the best rooms in the hotel when making the reservations. Our room was so dark that we almost needed a headlamp. The paint was peeling off the ceiling and the rug was pulled away from the wall. We would have changed rooms but other people in our group ended up sleeping on cots in their rooms because the beds were too small (a double instead of a queen or king). There was hair in the bathroom as well as mascara on the "clean" towels. The so called restaurant/bar was a ridiculous. It felt like it was out of the 70s with a very, very slow help. The food was awful. Getting to your room can be a challenge as well. There are three separate groups of elevators however 2 of the 3 sets only go from the garage or ground level to the lobby. The other set goes to the rooms (at a snails pace). If there was ever a fire in the building it would be a problem trying to find your way out.

Reviews.Title: “One of our Favorite in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jacques_Alex
Reviews.Content: For it's location, the updated rooms, lobby and restaurant, we consider this hotel as one of the most convenient in Montreal. Arrival and departure formalities are super fast. You have to get used to taking different elevators to go where you want. Valet and concierge always pleasant. Restaurant staff could be nicer during breakfast considering we're doing them a favour to eat there despite the somewhat excessive price.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: sj134
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours was able to get a group rate for this hotel and we decided to splurge and have our own rooms after seven nights of sharing. What a relief to be in Montreal! You do not need a car when staying here, the metro literally runs under St Catherine St, which the hotel is located on. It is in the center of the Arts District, two blocks from the small Chinatown, four from Old Montreal and its cobblestone streets, four from downtown and its throngs of shopping areas and a short ride away from Mount Royal Park by bus. There is a very nice food court below the hotel that connects to the underground pedestrian network spanning downtown, although at first the network is confusing, as is the layout of the Hotel. The lobby is very modern and has some great lounge areas and a nice bar, also visible is the indoor pool and outdoor deck, which is large enough for a wedding reception, as we saw during our stay. There is a gym, although a bit small, nothing special, but it does over look the pool. The staff was very helpful with directions and did not mind cleaning our room late in the afternoon. the rooms on the third floor could use some updating, the hallway was dark and very plain. the doorway inside the room has some strange planks along the ceiling that conceal something, but just look old and like they are holding some dust up above. The beds were great for sleep, we did not want to get up!

Reviews.Title: “great price for this location”
Reviews.Author: Hermoinevancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011 and found the hotel located within walking distance to Old Montreal, St. Catherine's Street and many restaurants. We were able to walk everywhere and did not rent a car . It is close to transit and we even used the bixi bikes which are located conveniently by this hotel. Our room rate included the breakfast buffet which is very nice . We found the staff very helpful- We did not get free wi fi in the room, however it is attached to a mall where there is free wi fi in the food court. The hotel has been renovated and looks fresh and modern. Lighting in the room was poor- a few more lamps would be nice to be able to read.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lettara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while on vacation this summer. Great location within walking distance of Old Montreal. Also has tons of restaurants and shopping very nearby. The hotel has a great pool and outside deck that was a hit with our kids. Overall a good family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kirby003
Reviews.Content: We received a group rate at $129CAD/night and the location was very convenient for where we needed to be. Self-parking in the building was also convenient but pricey as expected. Taking the elevators from the parking lot to the 6th floor lobby and then switching/finding the elevators to the room floors can be confusing. What was disappointing about our room was that there was no safe or refrigerator for a Hyatt Regency. The positives included a helpful concierge, remodeled lobby and hotel bar with very friendly bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: payanaToronto
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and close to the old port, china town. We could visit many attractions on foot from the hotel. The room was very clean and comfy. The lobby was beautiful. Connected to underground pathway.

Reviews.Title: “still a pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJamie
Reviews.Content: the renovations in the lobby and lounge are nice ... and overall the hotel is pretty good. the carpets are old and stained in the hallways and the rooms need updating

Reviews.Title: “Service. Absolutely horrendous, wouldn't recommend it, unless you want poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Nguyen2189
Reviews.Content: Doormen are rude! I don't know what it is, but I don't think a doorman should be opening my car door and slamming it on me is great service. It completely offended me and I will not be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love it here!”
Reviews.Author: Zenmouse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended Montreal World Film Festival in August and stayed for 4 nights at Regency Hyatt Montreal. This hotel has been renovated recently and is now beautiful. Rooms are comfortable and we had a room with purified air which is very good for people with allergies or asthma. We were warmly welcomed by Eric at our arrival. He even took the time to call us in our room to make sure that everything was to our satisfaction. Wow! There is a nice atmosphere in the lounge ( colors, furniture, music...). Breakfasts are also delicious!!! From this hotel you can walk everywhere or if you prefer, two subway lines can be accessed without going outside. As a matter of fact, you can walk kilometers without going out of the hÃ´tel through all Montreal underground shopping centers and restaurants. This place is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms and average service.”
Reviews.Author: WebsterCook
Reviews.Content: Disappointing end to our trip; poorest of the four star hotels we stayed at in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: P-Dub56
Reviews.Content: After reading the spotty reviews about this hotel I was a little nervous about making a reservation. I should not have been worried. This is an excellent hotel for the price. The location could not have been more perfect. There was a film festival going on right outside and its location in the arts district on the edge of the Asian Quarter right at a Metro stop provided all of the interest and color of the city we were seeking. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. Its location atop a mall and IGA made it very convenient for shopping and food, plus it connects by underground walkway to other areas so you never have to go outside when the weather is bad. The parking ($19/day) is a bargain when compared to other places. The only glitch we had was that I experienced the jumping elevator that others have mentioned here. As I started to step in it jumped up a good 6 inches and tripped me so that I fell into the elevator, leaving my startled wife in the hall as the doors closed. Please fix that thing before it kills someone! And the carpet in the hallways is dirty and needs to be replaced. Other than that, this hotel had everything we needed at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Love it !”
Reviews.Author: tx_pearland
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults + 8yr) stayed there for 3 night (0810-0813). Took 747 bus from airport to hotel. No pain at all. Very good location, is part of big complex, which has food court\grocery\eatery\shopping. We can walk to Old Montreal\China Town. Nice decor in lobby. Room is pretty clean. A little smaller than the hotel we stayed at Toronto and DC. Friendly front desk. A couple min to subway. Outside complex has big\beautiful splash, which changes color after dark. Very nice\clean pool\sauna\steam room. Live up to the Hyatt name. Con: wish there's a hot tub in the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, will go back there again”
Reviews.Author: Netman79
Reviews.Content: It was my first time at the Hyatt (my gf already been there once before they renovated). I must say the hotel is quite nice, room are clean (+ LCD TV, free wi-fi, mini-fridge) and the bed is very confortable. We had access to the regency private club where you have appetizer, dessert, drink (no alcool) and free continental breakfast in the morning (and this is no typical continental breakfast and there's a lot of outsider stuff like smoked salmon). The bar is also very nice and huge. The location is great, right in front of the "place des arts". I will definately go there the next time i go in montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NotTheGnome
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location for shopping (St. Catherines), Vieux Montreal, Metro, etc. and the pool area and sundeck were also great after a morning of shopping or exploring the city. The rooms were average, the elevator service was horrible we stood in line quite a bit just waiting to get into an elevator and the stairs are for emergency only and (we used them to walk down from the 8th floor anyway but the door ended in the mall and was locked to re-enter). Only two of four elevators were running and once when the air crew from Air France showed up they put a third elevator into service for a very short time. The service was just average (at times below average if I'm being honest - long line ups to speak to anyone and I really didn't meet anyone very helpful - it was rare to find someone on the concierge desk and front desk usually had line ups). The rooms were really nothing special but I will say that the beds were comfortable. Could have been a Holiday Inn or Delta (and I'm not dissing Delta - the more I stay at Delta properties the more I believe they offer the best value for your dollar - I kind of wish I had saved the extra we spent on the Hyatt and stayed at either of the Montreal Delta properties). Our window was so dirty on the inside that I cleaned it myself with towels (just how I want to spend my vacation) it looked like someone had put their oily head on it in many different places (probably to look at Place Des Arts) and maybe smeared butter on it... can't believe housekeeping hadn't caught that especially as we had paid a premium for our view (out the filthy window). I realize this is a mixed review - if you really care about location - this is a great property but I was disappointed with the elevators and how much time we wasted waiting for them (and no other access options - I really don't mind stairs) and the basic (premium for view) room. I didn't feel the extra $$ was warranted for this property...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Didier_Six
Reviews.Content: Took a chance and did the Expedia roulette. This hotel came up. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The location is ideal for walking around and looking for things to do downtown Montreal. McGill University was close as was shopping and dining on rue St. Catherine. The rooms were ample and the pool was spectacular and clean. I would definitely recommend this property for anyone wanting good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Regency Club Benefits”
Reviews.Author: LiteTraveler115
Reviews.Content: Went to Montreal for a convention, was wowed by the location of the Hyatt - walking distance to everything. Festival at the Place d'Arts was amazing. Always something going on in the hotel with various guests, yet room was clean, quiet. The Regency Club served wonderful hors d'oeuvres, breakfast, snacks, and desserts, along with great wine at essentially cost. We were pleasantly surprised with this private area, and feel the value was much greater than the cost to upgrade to the Regency Club level room. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst Hyatt we have ever stayed in, we will not make the same mistake again.”
Reviews.Author: Cheri_111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace to the Hyatt brand, it is rundown, old the service at the front desk is terrible. The lifts in the building are not only slow but extremely dangerous, on multiple occasions the lifts stop above the actual floor level and if your not looking at the floor whilst entering the lift you will go flying. The business center contains two computers which are hardly ever free. The iPod docking system which allows you to play music in the hotel room was not functioning and it took 3 phone calls and 4 days to get a replacement that worked. Getting out of the hotel takes 10-15 minutes just waiting for lifts. There was no refrigerator in our room and the tap water tasted like metal. Getting a bottle of water after11:30 at night is impossible because room service is over....you don't have a bar fridge....and reception will tell you to go to one of the hotel levels with a vending machine....... when your in your pajamas ,....ready to sleep...dying of thirst do you really want to get changed, wait 10 minutes for a lift to get to another floor only to find out you don't have the right amount of change. The heating and cooling system within the room was terrible, we were here on hot summers days, when we turned the air-con on nothing but hot air blew out for over an hour. This hotel seriously needs a huge revamp and new management. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: FunIntheSun
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying - there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel if you get a room at a reasonable price, which I did! Having said that, the area surrounding the hotel has a lot of construction taking place so access is not that easy. It's location is excellent being right on Ste Catherine across from the performing arts centre and with lots of pedestrian friendly walkways and streets nearby. The hotel itself starts off as a maze of elevators and parking garages (which by the way is $19 per night to park!) If you can find a place where parking is included this would be a bonus. Once you take the elevator to the lobby, the staff was courteous and efficient (but don't expect a warm and fuzzy feeling) they don't give you that kind of service... I was assigned a 1st floor (one above lobby) room which was clean and spacious - although only accessible by elevator. The carpet seemed relatively new and was of excellent quality... the rooms had been updated although this particular room #142 needed a little TLC with chipped corner edges and some wierd sort of wooden ceiling over some ductwork? Beds and pillows very comfortable and sheets clean crisp and good thread count! Nice to see the washable white cover over the duvet (hate the idea of unwashed duvet covers!) Also, when I use a hotel bathroom I can't stand being able to tell that the previous guest had long brown hair... This floor was a little noisy and perhaps too close to the street. Wi-fi was not included and was an additional fee per night - this should also be included like the parking... My overall impression was a 7/10. Good value for what I paid, but not a great setup as far as the elevators, parking fee, wi-fi fee, etc. Good location and overall a pretty clean hotel and room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room. Very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Mousers
Reviews.Content: Location - very convenient. It is on top of the mall downtown. - have restaurants, food court, dollar store, grocery, everything you will need as a visitor - walking distance to the bus / train / subway station - 5 minutes walk to China Town Room - We had two double beds in our room. The beds were comfortable. - Clean. - Lots of storage space. - I used the WiFi in the room almost constantly, it was working well - There was road contruction at time when we stayed, but our room was further away on the east side, it didn't bother me at all. - The parking was quite expensive. - You have to take two elevator to get to your room from the street level. It can be a bit hard if you have lots of luggage to deal with

Reviews.Title: “Good One, keep it up with the improvements.”
Reviews.Author: Fsanches
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a busy place... With all the constructions going on on the surrouding area it gets a little anoying. The rroms are good and the pool is above average for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel - Plenty better to choose one.”
Reviews.Author: jlsimpson71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in dire need of an update of their guest suites. We booked a two night trip and choose the Hyatt for its proximity to both downtown and Old Montreal. When we arrived I was encouraged by the lobby/reception area that was modern and updated but when we checked into our room it was very tired and in dire need of a complete make-over. The bathroom had mold on the ceilings and the room was dark. I think they only had 2 working elevators so they were crowded every time you went up or down and several times we had to wait for a less crowded elevator to get to our rooms. I have stayed in a Super 8 motel that looked better than this one did. I immediately regretted the decision to book at the Hyatt. An over abundance of kids in the pool didn't make the idea of relaxing by the pool a real option for us. Great if you have kids though.

Reviews.Title: “Good, large, brand name hotel. Great pool for kids.”
Reviews.Author: MikeAmherst
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our 9yr old daughter, she loved the pool which really was very nice. Pool is indoors but has an outdoor patio area for sunning. Also unisex steam and sauna rooms were well kept, very clean. We stayed on my hyatt points, room was very nice, although the exce suite we upgraded to had a faint smoke smell the 1st afternoon we got there. Lounge/bar is kind of cool with a 'sprockets' kind of feel (like a W, if you been to those). Reasonable walking distance to old montreal in a nice part of city. Right on top of shopping mall and iga grocery store if you need anything. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “...great place to be in the centre of things...”
Reviews.Author: acminkus
Reviews.Content: ...had to wait 3 hours to check in due to an incredibly busy saturday nite during the international jazz festival... they did their best under the circumstances, and gave me free internet during my stay to make up for the wait (which was much appreciated)... otherwise, great location, and very helpful staff... AND very quiet and comfortable room...

Reviews.Title: “Best find ever”
Reviews.Author: PNCHIEF
Reviews.Content: I have travelled many places and stayed in many hotels, but this had to have been one of the best ones ever. All of the staff were friendly and very helpful and it was a delight to be treated like I was really special! The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable -- would loved to have taken them home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but service isnt there..”
Reviews.Author: campo84748
Reviews.Content: Location is great if its not during the jazz festival. You cant get near the place if it is. Rooms are nice , bed is cozy. Internet is expensive and should be free! I hate to be nickeled and dimed. And the service is basically non-existance all but for 30$ a day valet parking and the concierge who is allright. I asked for ice in the room and the answer was get it yourself. The lobby and pool area is very very pretty with a big unique fireplace and cool bar too. The underground mall is a nice feature to have there too. I really liked it but wouldnt pay more then 150 a night for it here under any circumstance. Try getting it on priceline for a bid..they call it a 4 star on there, but its not. Also the place is overrun with airline personel. You cant get near an elevator which are confusing and slow anyway. Overall its just a short walk from the old part of the city which is really the best part of staying here. Also you have the latin quarters and chinatown and all kinds of other "towns" nearby. I enjoyed my time there, just wish so much of it wasnt wasted on waiting for elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very busy but surprisingly quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Mhlia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of July 2011... during the Juste Pour Rire (Just For Laughs) ComicCon. Which we didn't know about until we showed up at the hotel. Immediately dismayed and overwhelmed by people. The good news... our room - on the 10th floor was quite. I never heard the music or hoopla going on just outside the hotel. The location of the hotel was great. Most of our destinations could be reached on foot within a mile or so (1.5-1.8 km) including Old Town Montreal. Metro access is also very easy with on immediately near by and the other a few blocks away. The hotel was comfortable with the room and bathroom a little on the small side. While one front desk attendant was a bit surly the rest were pleasant.
