Getting in and out of the elevators was a bit of a hassle with all of the people, but we usually didn't have to wait for more than one. Breakfast was *expensive* if you go with the buffet (best bet if you breakfast at the hotel every day is to get the AAA breakfast rate). The Complexe Desjardins is below which is very convenient - there is an IGA (grocery market) as well as restaurants and shops. I'd say we are likely to stay here again the next time we are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Rooms requiring much needed update”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDano
Reviews.Content: My family and I attended the Jazz Festival in July 2011. The location was perfect, dead centre of all the action, fantastic. The terrace overlooked St. Catherine Street and allowed us to relax with a drink. The pool was a good size with great lounging chairs and a window that opened up to the outdoor terrace. The rooms on the other side were small, with only 2 double beds. The mattresses and pillows were sub standard and the bathroom was very tin, with a very small sink and the tub that leaked which became a nuisance with a large puddle after each showering. I would stay here again only if the rooms are modified better for comfort., i.e. larger bed, pillows, in room safe, in room fridge and a much larger bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadma
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night while visiting Montreal with my kids. The hotel is beautiful. A little akward and confusing at first to make your way to the lobby, but we got used to it quickly. We used self parking and it cost us $19 in the underground parking. No bad at all. The rooms are very nice. The service is excellent everywhere. Lots of places to shop/eat around. There is noisy construction going on around the hotel but never at night and we slept like babies. When we arrived, I felt a little out of place with my kids in our shorts and t-shirts as this hotel is very classy and all the employees are dressed to impress but we were never treated like we did not belong. I would highly recommend this hotel. I hope to stay there again. I got a good deal with Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: rozwrite
Reviews.Content: All the critical reviews are true. This is not a four star place, worth the price but if you're looking for a central location with basic amenities, it's okay. The lobby has a crazy 2nd floor location with no signs or explanations. I was never informed about the locations of anything in the hotel so I had to discover things on my own.The breakfast buffet is standard but nothing great, with a snotty host.The maid service is appalling. I had to call at 5PM because the room had not yet been cleaned for the day. I did not get washcloths until the 3rd day. The good points are that the front desk staff and concierge are helpful, the waiters in the restaurant are gracious and the location is very accessible for the rest of the city. If you're used to 4 or 5 star service you'll be disappointed but if not, you will not have a prblem.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Matka-arvostelut
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for a family vacation, as it has a got a swimming pool also. The location is quite good. During our stay there were some renovation work going on, but this is over now, I guess. The service of the personnel was friendly and we felt welcome there. It was quite convenient that the hotel was attached to a shopping centre. While we went shopping, we could leave our winter gear in our room and try clothes more easily. It was freezing cold outside!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern on the inside.”
Reviews.Author: JimRiesterer
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two days in Montreal on business and stayed in a king room at the Hyatt Montreal. I must admit I almost cancelled after reading a couple of the reviews on this site but am glad I didn't. The hotel was quite comfortable, modern and very clean. I was assigned a room on the 8th floor which was quite large and pretty quiet. Location-wise it was great. There is a large open area in front of the hotel which was the sight of a totally fun summer festival - the just for laughs festival with tons of free, family friendly entertainment. In short, wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good priceline value”
Reviews.Author: JuliF
Reviews.Content: We bid on priceline, like some other reviewers, but were much better pleased with our experience. Our room was clean and very quiet, the bed luxurious,TV modern, the price excellent. Use biddingfortravel.com for bidding guidelines. Hints about parking -- don't use the hotel rate if you drive. The attached Complex Desjardins offers 24 hours at 19$C, a much better rate. Enter off of Rue Jeanne-Mance. Instead of pulling up to the hotel loop in the garage, look for a down ramp (on your immediate right) with a black P and a green circle. Go down a level or two and park by the elevators that say Jeanne-Mance exit.Keep yr ticket to prepay when you leave, by the elevators (you'll use validated ticket at the exit) Go up to 6, and you're in the bar of the hotel. 2 or 3 put you into the mall, a pleasant one with a drugstore if needed (Jean Coutu). Parking in old Montreal is a challenge. We'll repeat the experience. Very convenient to walk to the old port (15-20 minutes) All that said, my husband speaks local French and maybe that helps us have happy experiences.

Reviews.Title: “fine room”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night in June. The room was very nice, the beds were extremely comfortable, so were the pillows. It was clean and quiet (our room was on the inside, not on the street side which I'm sure would be annoying during festival time). Staff was nice at check-in. We had the regency special so we were allowed in the special lounge for cocktail hour and also for breakfast. Both were very good. Not a huge selection but more than enough. And quiet. We enjoyed the pool, there weren't many people. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: chic84
Reviews.Content: I was going to Montreal for a weekend trip for a concert and picked Hyatt Regency because it was on top of a mall and the train station was right under the mall. It made getting toiletries convenient since I forgot to pack toothpaste and contacts solution. Because I traveled by train to the hotel, I had trouble finding the entrance from the mall. I tried calling the hotel and they start of helped me. Having the hotel above the train stop is great but it can also be scary when you travel at night. The first night, I got back to the hotel around 11PM-midnight, and when I walked through the completely empty mall, it was scary. I wasn't even sure if I was allowed to walk through the mall after hours but I couldn't find my way out otherwise. The some of the check-in staff were nice. My second night there, it was really late and I really wanted to try poutine but didn't want to go far, so the gentleman at check-in recommended the restaurant near-by. I had some concern with traveling to the airport the next day by shuttle and he also helped me call the company to make sure everything will be fine. When I needed the internet to check some quick emails and check-in for my flight, they allowed me to use the concierge computer (not sure if that is part of the hotel amenities), which I was glad so I didn't have to pay to use the internet for a few minutes. The hotel is also in walking distance to Chinatown and the Old Port, so I would go down there, get back to the hotel to drop stuff off and then head out again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: DJ73
Reviews.Content: I am a member of Hyatt's loyalty program and have always been pleased with my stays; until this one. The room was very small. Although I requested a king size bed, the room had a double or queen. Also, there were white stains on the office chair. We stayed here for three days, on the second day the hotel held a pool party for 7 hours with extremely loud music. Speakers were aimed directly at the hotel (our room). I like loud music but not when my wife has a migraine and is trying to nap. When I called the front desk, they gave me the option of "leaving the room for a while". The front desk manager that I spoke to upon checkout said " I heard it was very loud and that it could be heard from 4 blocks away." I have never experienced anything like that, including stays on cruise ships and the Las Vegas strip. Additionally, the room next door was very loud as well. We could hear every conversation, cough, snort and grunt. Finally, while our floor was supposed to be non smoking, the hotel apparantly changed this to suit the request of a large group they had booked. Again, as with the pool party, we were not told a head of time (giving us the opportunity to plan accordingly). It was only when I woke up coughing and in need of my inhaler that I realized the neighbors were smoking. Again, the front desk was of no assistance in solving this problem. The hotel management must be rather short sighted in that they hope to make a quick buck by catering to a small group while disregarding the satisfaction of other guests. Finally, there were carpet nails that were coming up right outside of the bathroom. I look forward to returning to Montreal but will avoid this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Dana2011_06
Reviews.Content: We got a good price and the hotel looked Okay until we were attacked by bed bugs! the management moved us to another room and told us it was the first time they encounter such a problem, which we later found out to be a lie. Nothing else really mattered after that.

Reviews.Title: “One star for location and one star for price, but bad facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: Monterone
Reviews.Content: It was fun to stay in the very heart of the Montreal Jazz Festival during the last week of June. This hotel is centrally located, with a large shopping mall (and grocery) in the adjacent building, and a short walk to many downtown sites, including Old Montreal. The price was also very good, compared to other similar hotels. In fact, we were able to book a special Costco rate, where we paid for two nights and the third night was free. The service, however, was a mixed bag. Amazingly, it broke down precisely along gender lines: the women were consistently kind and helpful, and the men were rude and standoffish. When I was checking in, the man at the front desk ignored the line of regular customers and allowed the Air France flight attendants to cut in front of us, even though we had been waiting longer. The woman who checked me in, by contrast, was apologetic and friendly. The portly and stiff gentleman in charge of the club lounge one evening kept reminding us that children were not allowed in the lounge between 5pm and 7:30pm, when alcohol was being served, even though we came in with the kids after 7:30 and closer to 8:00pm. (By the way, what kind of a silly rule is that? That was not the case at the Intercontinental Montreal down the street. It's not like our kids, ages 2 and 7, were going to drink alcohol.) On another night, however, the lounge attendant (Stephanie) was very sweet with our two boys and even went into a back room to get them a couple of toys to keep. Throughout our stay, we saw this gender disparity on display repeatedly. As noted, we had access to the club lounge, but the continental breakfast was weak, with stale pastries and very few pieces of cheese and smoked salmon. The evening offerings were even worse, and we gave up on the lounge after the second day. Easily one of the worst lounges in the Hyatt system (and certainly the worst I've seen outside the United States.) The guest rooms were small and functional, but not much more. We had a suite for our family, which was basically just two tiny rooms (one with a sofa) stuck together. Would I stay here again? Only if I got another really good deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Run away!”
Reviews.Author: LotusRacing
Reviews.Content: As an old time Hyatt Gold Passport member with with almost 500,000 points this is one of the biggest Hyatt disappointments to date. First I agree with others don't waste your money on "Regency Club" which has to be one of the worst ever. The "Club" floor is on lobby level, which is a first. And the Club attendant aka the "Liquor Nazi" refuses to allow you to take the drink you paid for to your room, however the bar just outside the door has no problem with this. The bar attendant says he hears these complaints daily. When I asked why he didn't inform the manager he said he didn't know who was the general manager, this place needs a management restructuring foe sure. The safe was locked when we arrived but we called down and were told to just wait 30 minutes and it would open!! Seriously!! I can't believe the staff here. When we checked in we did not get the keys for club access which we paid for and then those keys didn't work so we had to get replacements. I've stayed in Hyatts all over the world and this one is at the bottom. There are better hotels in this city for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ancient and tacky”
Reviews.Author: OperationWayne
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel! Apart from the location and a decent pool, you can do much better in montreal. I made the mistake of bidding on priceline and was assigned this hotel. Four stars has never bee so exxagerated. It started with the horrible decor of the hotel, terrible service feom a rude concierge and stinky, dirty rooms being covered up by harsh air fresheners. Then the hotel has the nerve to charge $13 a day for wifi access. Maybe they are qfraid someone will try to book a hotel elsewhere. Seriously: don't stay here if you want a pleasant overall hotel experience. And who designed that lobby and lounge? Ikea could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than some of the reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: lsnhc
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Montreal and were able to get The Hyatt Regency at a great price on Priceline.com. I was very surprised to find that the Montreal Jazz Festival had not ended, and as the Hyatt was one of the "headquarter" hotels (and adjacent to the festival), the availability was a real surprise. The bottom line: It appears that most of the renovation has been completed and the hotel is very much up to date. Is it in the "luxury" category? - most definitely not, but as a business class property, it is very competitive and the staff could not have been more accommodating or helpful. Given its great location - near the Old City, the main shopping and commercial areas, and numerous music and entertainment venues, I would definitely recommend the Hyatt Regency MOntreal.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but needs a bit more thought put into customer experience”
Reviews.Author: tripbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights. Check-in was pleasant, and the public areas looked good. My room was clean and comfortable, but lacked some of the things I would expect in a four star hotel (and which I found at the next hotel I stayed at in Montreal). There was no full-length mirror, no room safe, no robe, no mini-bar or fridge. Some electrical fittings were hanging off the wall and there was rotting wood in the bathroom. The sink and bath plugs didn't work, but were fixed when requested. The alarm clock went off when I was asleep, so hadn't been cleared after the previous guest. These things take the edge off what could be a good hotel (the bar and other services seemed fine, as did the staff - and the location is ideal). I think it could do with a visit from the Hyatt equivalent of the mystery shopper to see what it feels like to be a guest. Also, paying for internet access feels silly in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: KansasHummingbird
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal to embark on a Canada/New England Cruise, and the Hyatt was the Holland America hotel for passengers staying the night before sailing. It is a very modern-looking hotel â€“ quite pleasing. We had an excellent check-in with a very friendly and helpful staff. We were assigned room 851, which was quite large, clean, and quiet. It also had an air purifier which I had not seen in a hotel before now. I would highly recommend this hotel, even though there was quite a bit of construction going on in the surrounding area. We chose to walk downtown instead of visiting the attached mall. The downtown area was quite lively, with lots of people. Dinner at Restaurant Julien on Rue Union was fantastic. The next morning, we enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the CafÃ© Fleuri which was very nicely prepared.

Reviews.Title: “For the value, it's good.”
Reviews.Author: wwkwok
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is centrally located and therefore you are just steps away from shopping, latin quarter, restaurants, Old Montreal and the busy street of St. Catherine's. Just below the Hyatt is a very nice shopping mall making it convenient for freshly brewed coffee in the morning, snacks and general shopping whether it be clothes or groceries (IGA located in the mall). Service at the Hyatt was pleasant. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only odd and questionable aspect is having to take two elevators to get to your room. As mentioned, for the value it was good.

Reviews.Title: “If you like cookies”
Reviews.Author: Marjory16
Reviews.Content: If you like cookies then pay extra for Club Level as you get them every day for afternoon tea and evening dessert. Nothing else, just cookies. There are no other reasons for paying the extra for Club access. No free WiFi in this day and age is shocking. ($12.95 + taxes) There is no evening restaurant in this hotel and room service is not 24 hours. i have stayed in other Hyattt's and expected the same standards. My expectations were not met.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagsfromScotland
Reviews.Content: Loved this area of the city but the Hyatt was really not worth the very high price. The cost of the wi-fi per day is exhorbitant. It is difficult to find your way around as there are no directions or signs anywhere. No concierge service until 1pm (pointless, as everyone's left the hotel by then) Do not pay extra for the Regency Club room, it is a joke. The rigid rules they have are just laughable & their snacks were non existent. They lock the doors at 9pm for some reason so you cant get access to their meagre two pc's. Their room descriptions are misleading. Im still waiting to see the pampering toothpaste products...we didnt get any and they never topped up shower gels etc so they ran out. A/C very loud. The management should take a long hard look at the poor service they provide & learn to be more flexible and customer friendly

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, No signage, Poor Check-in/out, shame since its a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: We were really torn about the Hyatt Regency. While the location and our room were ok, the staff at this hotel were not. The hotel has undergone a large number of renovations, which are readily apparent and likely improve the hotel (although the bar as soon as you exit the elevators is a bit too eclectic for us). The check-in desk is in a terrible location though. There are numerous entrances to the hotel from the ground level, but the check-in desk is not at ground level, forcing you to take an elevator up. The issue is there isn't any signage of where check-in actually is! I walked around for 15 minutes trying to figure it walking through the mall, up to their conference center, and finally out to the front where valet parking is where I had to ask the valet (who was EXTREMELY rude about telling me where the check-in was). It took 30minutes to check-in as the lines were incredibly long. The entire area to check-in was a loud mess as there were only two people at the desk checking in probably 50 or so people. There were also only two elevators working, so a massive amount of people waiting beside the check-in area to actually get up to their rooms. It also took 30 minutes to check-out of the hotel, with the same issues as check-in. They desperately need better staff at this hotel, which is a bit of a shock for a chain that "prides itself" on their staff. We were given club access, which was nice, but not really worth the cost. The club room was in a good location, had big windows, but the "breakfast" and "snacks" were not well thought out. Why sliced meat at breakfast, snacks, AND dessert? Why feta lettuce wraps for breakfast? The club room was also not attended to properly, and dishes and garbage piled up. The attendant disappeared for the entire hour we were there in the morning, and we never saw one for the "snack" period. I wouldn't pay for this access again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: HOTELJUNKY88
Reviews.Content: Many aspects of this hotel are charming..They override some of the inconveniences...such as slower elevators,,some hotel renovations..and the construction plaguing much of Montreal....I find the windows are too small for my liking..and felt a little claustrophobic..and had to re-locate to a double where my bed was at least parallel with the window affording the view outside...The club lounge is very comfortable and relaxing and there is much charm on the terrace and adjoining gardens and walkways...The pool area is inviting, with its multitude of comfortable lounge chairs..indoors and out!! There are windows everywhere , even on the ceiling, making it very outdoorish,,,I loved the hip... bar area with its banquettes,, and throw pillows.. the lights above the bar. and the chill lounge music make you want to hang-out!!!The fare was pretty standard in the club lounge..but quite enjoyable....I am gluten free and still found plenty to eat...Lots of water bottles..and Perrier to enjoy...Staff was friendly-enough...Requests were met with expediency!! The location says it alll....steps away from china town..and a small walk to Old Montreal...and in the heart of downtown.....I would stay there again...as always guided by price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bnj2377
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I didn't pay for my hotel stay. I'm a Hyatt Rewards member and used a free night to 'pay' for my one night stay. When I looked online at prices, they were quite high which I thought was ridiculous but we were also there during the week before the Grand Prix race. Here's the rundown: **Location, location, location - The hotel is right near the Place des Arts Metro station and really close to the bus line. We took the airport express bus and it dropped us off a block away. It's also connected to a large shopping center, which is quite convenient for shops and restaurants (We had one meal at the Baton Rouge restaurant - good food and reasonable prices). It's about a 20 minute walk to Old Montreal and Notre Dame (you can take the metro instead for a quicker trip). There is a Starbucks literally caddy corner from the hotel and the Rue St Catherine (where you can find tons of shopping and restaurants) crosses the hotel as well. The Plaza accross from the hotel hosts many festivals and is super convenient if you are attending one. **Room - the room was nice, typical Hyatt, not anything overwhelmingly fabulous but nicely appointed, clean, flat screen tv, etc. The bathroom was a little small but it's not like we were planning to spend much time in the bathroom. Had a king size bed that was comfy and clean. Our view was of an empty parking lot accross the street and then some city skyline. We didn't really care since we weren't planning to hang out in the hotel much. **Hotel - There are massage services onsite for a reasonable price as well as a pool and sauna. I didn't have time to use them but seriously considered it. ;o). Room service is available but ridiculously pricey, as room service usually is, and it's available until 11:30 PM. The WiFi wasn't free, which was the one thing that really irritated me. It was $12.95 for 24 hours, which isn't exorbitant, but for the price per room they charge, you'd think they'd throw in WiFi for free. The front desk staff was great, very helpful with suggestions on things to see, how to get to places, etc. They are all multilingual, which was awesome since my husband speaks no French and mine is limited to "Please give me 'X'; 'I would like to get off at bus stop 'X'"; and a few other phrases ;o). I got offered a late checkout for free (although I think this was because I'm a Hyatt Rewards member). There was no concierge, which was a little odd, but the front desk staff subbed nicely. Some reviewers have commmented on the elevator situation but honestly, I didn't find it to be a big deal at all. Essentially, you take an elevator from the ground floor to the lobby (the bell staff pointed out which elevator to take but we could have figured it out). Then from the lobby elevators, you walk accross the lobby (it's not that big so it's not as if it's a long walk) to the elevators that go to the rooms. That's all. Not a big deal so I'm not sure what people are whining about. it was relatively busy when we were there and in terms of speed of elevators, they aren't rocket elevators but unless you are in a super hurry, it's fine. They don't slip the bill under the door for 'auto' checkout, which is a little unusual but I actually found that with several Montreal hotels so maybe it's a Montreal thing. Checkout was easy though, there wasn't much of a line when I went and I wasn't in a hurry. There was quite a bit of construction going on around the hotel when I was there which isn't ideal but that isn't the hotel's fault. All in all, we had a good experience here and I'd definitely stay here again if we could find a good deal on pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: adamfoxiscool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a bachelor party of about 10 this past May. There was a ton of inconsistencies between the 5 rooms we occupied which were all the same price. E.g. some rooms had a mini fridge, some did not. Some got a complimentary bag of cookies, some did not. There was also a lot of construction and renovation happening which did not help in the matter. All in all, this stay was adequate but I'd stay somewhere cheaper next time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “So close-yet so far .”
Reviews.Author: bigguyinpasadena
Reviews.Content: Had 2 stays this past week. No seperate line for elites is a big pain at a property this large. I was checked out by a trainee who had a lot of problems handling a cash/charge payment for the bill. She also was insistent about extra charges to my room that should not have been there.It took a long time to straighten her out on this-and of course I was in a hurry..As a GP Diamond I should have been checked out by someone with more experience.This happened to me last year as well. I had an issue in the Regency club with the evening presentation. Some of the items are seafood based but are placed on the buffet without any refrigeration. The shrimp were spoiled and the smell was obvious.I pointed this out to the attendant and rather than removing the shrimp immediatly he made some phone calls first and then(perhaps 10 minutes later)removed them. The four attendants for the lounge ran the gammut for a trainee who should not have been unsupervised to a fella we met there last year who could not have been snootier. The other two just could not have been bothered with anything but clearing tables. Renovations are 90% complete in the hotel. But the renovations to rooms are minor instead of the total renovation that is really needed. The area around the hotel is still a total mess.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency probably deserves 4 stars for the level of services it provides. The location is awesome: opening into the spectacular Complexe Desjardins shopping center and Place Des Arts concert hall, the Metro and the rest of Montrealâ€™s underground city. Thereâ€™s a pool, workout room, room service, banquet facilities. But a 4 star hotel should have something extra that leaves you saying â€œwow - thatâ€™s good service.â€� Thatâ€™s what I found lacking in my recent 4 night stay. Front desk service was crisp and professional, but not friendly or outgoing in the slightest. Room service shut down at 11:30 PM, surprising in a late night city like Montreal. Bathroom fixtures were ordinary, furniture was utilitarian, there was no refrigerator or minibar, the flat-screen TV was non-HD basic cable, internet cost $12.95/day. Free newspapers in the lobby vanished by 10 AM. There should be something in a 4 star hotel that inspires you to take a picture, or write home about, and aside from its terrific location this Hyatt doesnâ€™t create that moment. Noise can be a problem. I heard some noise from hallways and adjacent rooms, and from 7:30 AM until evening I heard continuous noise from three service elevators that happened to be next to my room. The hotel lobby was undergoing massive reconstruction, apparently now finished. Outside, St. Catherine St. is also undergoing heavy construction. Take advantage of the Complexe Desjardins for its excellent supermarket, shopping, and SAQ liquor market. There's an excellent food court with a wide variety of food where you can surf the internet for free until they kick you out at around 11:30 PM. You may find a low price rack rate or Priceline deal on the Hyatt. With that in mind, this hotel is barely satisfactory as a 4 star property, but no more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - Dark Dingy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Garsonites
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for a conference in Montreal and were truly disappointed. Although the hotel looks classy from the outside, and the lobby and amenities offered to the public via the lobby are nice, the rooms are dark & dingy. The lighting in the bathroom was so dim, my wife had to use a washroom off the looby to put on her makeup during her stay....the street access is cumbersome, as you have to take an elevator down to the parking area to access street level, and the elevator was one Moses used to load the Ark. Also, charging $13 a day for internet is absurd. With so many hotels available in downtown Montreal, this one is definitely one I would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had hopped for..... disappointed”
Reviews.Author: olbear1962
Reviews.Content: Well Hyatt's are usually pretty nice places to stay, not so for the Hyatt Regency Montreal. The rooms are very average and definately not 4 stars, or even 3 stars..... The staff were very friendly and helpfull, the decor was aweful "tacky" is the best I can describe, I was told they just renovated the entry foyer :( I can see why I couldnt get a room at other establishments nearby, they were all a better choice than this place. The room service food is what got me the most!! Absolutley AWEFULL, the worst I have ever had at an supposedly upmarket hotel, very expensive to boot! Both my wife and I felt ill during the night. NEVER AGAIN at this location! Life is too short to stay at crappy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - good location, not really a 4 star though”
Reviews.Author: trent_doubledown
Reviews.Content: Got a great value via priceline ($90) - but have to argue the 4 star rating. I've stayed in the Omni and Intercontinental - both are nicer - but never got as good a deal. Location is great - right at the shopping strip and only 15 minute walk to old montreal. Lobby was great, and staff were friendly - although having to take 2 separate elevators to get from car to the room got tiring. Rooms were very dated - which is where my primary complaint came from - cleaniliness left something to be desired, just a dated room compared to others in the same area and rating. I believe the regular rate is over $130 - which I really would have been ticked at paying given the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but just okay”
Reviews.Author: Emy1
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be very convienient and walking distance to China Town, St. Catherines, Notre Dame Cathedral and the Port of Montreal. We parked in the underground parkade and during the weekend it was reasonable but quite expensive during the weekdays. From the parkade to the lobby was a bit confusing. You had to change 2 elevators just to get to the lobby and it wasn't very clearly marked. Once you got to the lobby it was very bare and not very inviting. The staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. We went up to our rooms and they were just okay. The bathroom was kind of small, but the room was very clean and the beds and pillows were so comfortable! We didn't have any view at all we looked out onto the top of a room and other buildings but I guess that is what you get when you book through priceline. I didn't like the fact that it didn't offer free internet service. I just figure that all hotels should offer this as a lot of travellers bring their laptops with them. Overall its not that this hotel wasn't nice its just that I guess I thought we would get more out of a 4 star hotel. If you want a basic hotel in a good location with friendly staff then this would be a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in April and as much as I would want to give this Hyatt a better rating, I just couldn't. The location is not bad, it is after all, connected to a mall and one can get stuffs from the supermarket easily. You can also walked in the underground passageway to reach the subway station. I heard that in summer time, the adjoining plaza out of the hotel is filled with people as there'll be some festivals going on. You can also walk to Chinatown then to Old Montreal from this hotel. Probably around 30 minutes. The location also gets very quiet at night. The hotel itself is a typical Hyatt. The pool looks awesome, but I did not try it. There's one restaurant there but I did not eat there. Go to the brasserie t! opposite the hotel instead. It's a chic bistro by famed Montreal chef Normand Laprise and is affordable. The food is nice too, definitely better than the Mall offerings. Front desk was very friendly and attentive but the housekeeping was a complete letdown. They did not bother to make my room after I left the room at 4pm. I know I left abit late, but this has never happened in other places I had been to before. The room was ok. You can see they did bother to update the decor but still, you can spot some leftover stuffs. The bed as nice, but the shower could have been better. I'll recommend this hotel only if you get a good rate less than 100 usd per night like I did through one of those bidding sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, right on St Catherine West.”
Reviews.Author: tracywade
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a mall, so food and shopping is at your fingertips. Rooms are clean, but the doors must be extra thin because you can hear normal conversation through them. However I enjoyed my morning coffee in a clean and comfy room before doing some quality shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, Restaurant a Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Canuckinbklyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, although the bathrooms were a very small and the room could use a bigger mirror. The hotel's restaurant, Cafe Fleuri, on the other hand, was a disaster. They brought me the wrong order, but still worse, my wife's mussels were cold, not room temperature cold, ICE cold! She sent them back TWICE. (They must have the mussels pre-cooked and then refrigerated or frozen.) She finally settled on a salad, which was fine and which she ate after I had long since finished my meal, which had been corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction and not looking so good.”
Reviews.Author: twiggers77
Reviews.Content: I wasn't terribly impressed with this hotel, hence the "average review." Apparently the hotel is under construction and you can tell. The hallways were dingy (lots of marks on the walls). I'm not sure if the rooms have been upgraded, but if so, not impressed. The TV kept cutting in and out. The location was OK. I was at a conference at the Palais des Congres and the hotel was about a 10 minute walk through an underground system. It was generally a pain to get in and out of the hotel itself...requiring you to transfer elevators to get to the reception. The bed was comfortable, but that was about it. If I had to pay for this hotel, there would be no way I would stay again. The staff was very nice though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gatine
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through the name your price option at Priceline. For the location, it was a great deal! The lobby has been remodeled recently but I'm not a fan. Very sterile and modern. I prefer comfy seating and a business center. Room: comfy bed, well decorated. Only downside is bathroom lacks ventilation and the dryer was out of service (they did bring a hand held one at my request). We were there for a weekend, it was very quiet. Slept well. The pool area looked quite nice, but we didn't try it out. The hotel seems to be still under renovations which sometimes makes finding its services a bit awkward. We struggled to locate the bar, which was temporarily in a hospitality suite. The hotel is near everything. I would be happy to get this hotel again on priceline or hotwire but not sure I would pay full price for it...

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for money.”
Reviews.Author: pat767
Reviews.Content: Was looking to relax and get away for a night. Check-in was terrible. There were 2 people in front of me and I waited for nearly 20 minutes before getting taken care of. The staff was unable to provide a king sized bed. Only two doubles. They said the nice view would compensate. Huh??!! The hotel is undergoing renovations. The lobby floor looks empty, lacks decoration and signs to give directions to other areas/amenities. The bar, very difficult to find, can be found by: exiting the hotel to the mall, taking an elevator to another floor. No ambiance whatsoever, as the "temporary bar" is located in a conference room. The place was overcrowded and felt claustrophobic and unwelcoming. Internet goes for $12.95 a day. Ripoff, as other hotels offer it for free. Nice touch: little bar area in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff but rooms need some renovation”
Reviews.Author: Wolffian
Reviews.Content: To be fair the hotel is undergoing renovation, at least on the outside and hopefully the rooms will receive an update soon. Nothing too major but noticed corners of wallpaper peeling off walls, bathrooms tiles are older and furniture getting passed it's prime. Bed was fine. Rooms were pricey but again, it is in the heart of Montreal. The hotel is part of/attached to a shopping mall, which made working out the floors on the two elevators a challenge on the first day. After that, no problem. Terrific location for just about everything, walking distance to McGill University, shopping and the old port. I found the staff at the front desk to be extremely helpful, speaking fluent English and French. Pretty good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: booksandtravel
Reviews.Content: For a four star hotel the Hyatt Regency is disappointing. The renovations make it difficult to fully enjoy and the redecorated lobby does not accurately represent the outdated rooms. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable but the room was dated. They also charge $12.99 for high speed internet which I consider insanely expensive. I booked my room using Priceline and got a pretty good deal but I certainly wouldn't have wanted to pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glinnesa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a last minute trip to Montreal. The hotel was easy to find. My only issue was not being able to easily get from the parking garage to the check-in desk. But it did not take long to find my way around. My rate included buffet breakfast. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean and very nice as well as a nice bathroom. The staff pointed me to a great restaurant in the area and everything i wanted to see was in walking distance from the hotel. I am looking to go back to Montreal this summer and this hotel is definitely top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaPedersen
Reviews.Content: My friend enjoyed this classy hotel for a girls weekend! It was very quiet and loved the recent renovations. The breakfast restaraunt attached is excellent as well as Baton Rouge the ribs place. Staff were very helpful and check in/out was a breeze! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Tleah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for three nights. It's a beautiful hotel, great location near the metro and lots of shopping. Room was clean and comfortable. Was surprised that wi-fi was not included considering the cost of the room. Hotel was under construction but this didn't affect our stay. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Service, Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Maritimer60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in the Hyatt Regency. We booked on Priceline and I would have to say that we got an exceptional price on the booking. The hotel was under renovation, therefore the Lobby and Dining Rooms were temporary locations, but this was a minor inconvenience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is conveniently located adjacent to the Place Des Arts and one block from Chinatown. A few blocks from downtown Montreal which makes for a nice walk along St. Catherine Street. The Metro is only a short distance and can be accessed through Complexe Desjardins, a shopping complex linked to the hotel. I have never written a review up until now, but decided that I should do so as I had read previous reviews prior to the trip and there were mixed messages - some had suggested the hotel was a bit dated and wasn't up to a four star standard. While it wasn't the Waldorf Astoria, it was clean, the rooms were well maintained and no doubt the renovations will enhance the ambiance. For the price we paid, I would have to say it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mcanatellino
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, we were able to walk alot. We received efficient service at the front desks and our room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, decent location but beware smoky rooms!”
Reviews.Author: UJ99
Reviews.Content: Location â€“ The hotel is right next to (or perhaps even in) the Complexe Desjardins mall. I have never seen a hotel which you can enter directly from the mall. This puts you on the East side by the water, and at the top end of the main street, Rue St-Catherine. We chose to park in the mall parking lot which is much cheaper than hotel parking, and just as convenient, unless you are one of those people that absolutely have to have valet parking. It can be a bit confusing finding your way from the underground parking to the mall and then in to the hotel, but worth it. Montreal is a very walkable city and you are very close to museums, shops and the park. Check-in â€“We were there for a conference, so check-in was packed, but the line moved pretty efficiently. When we got to the front, the desk clerk retrieved our reservation and said that the non-smoking King rooms were gone, but she had a non-smoking two Queen room, or smoking King. We opted for the smoking King, but were told that it is a bit smoky, which we said was fine. She then elaborated that even smokers find it a bit smoky - at that point we changed to the non-smoking queen! She told us that even though the website says that WiFi access is a paid service, that for this weekend (perhaps due to the conference) it was free. Room â€“ The room was a little walk from the elevator, but nothing strenuous. We had a view out on to Rue Jeanne-Mance, which provided a nice enough view of the downtown area. The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom was also roomy, and had a full bath as well as shower. They provided robes in the room which is always a nice touch. There was ample desk size, which meant we could spread out our things and comfortably set up our laptop. The free WiFi was quick to set up and access, and even though it said it would charge the service to the room, as the desk clerk had said we were not charged upon check out. We did notice that room service trays seem to sit outside rooms for quite long periods of time. Amenities â€“ The upside of the location of the hotel is you can go to the food court, shops or even the grocery store without going outside, which may be desirable at the right time of year! There is a decent sized pool, and supposedly a hot tub, but it was not obvious where this was. The fitness center was adequately stocked, and had a few treadmills, a couple of elliptical as well as weight machines and a row of dumbbells. We did not eat at the restaurant, but there is one. We did have a drink at the bar, and this was fine, better than one might expect when your view is the mall. The service and selection was good and the bar snacks were plentiful. Check-out â€“ Even though there were many people checking out due to the end of the conference, the wait was very acceptable, and the staff was very efficient. Overall, a good hotel in a decent location and we had no complaints, but with so much competition (much of it right downtown), we would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Under renovation but the service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: debDanvilleVt
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i did not know what to expect. My husband and i have stayed at this hotel numerous times and have not been disappointed. Our visit this time wwas no exception. Would stay again. deb

Reviews.Title: “Under contruction, but it's fine”
Reviews.Author: chompere
Reviews.Content: We used PriceLine so we got a cheap room which was a good value. I would not want to pay full price but it was great for the price. Spacious rooms, lovely views, pleasant desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated. Service bad. Rooms dated and not so clean.”
Reviews.Author: lmnop88a
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying. Priceline gives it a 4-star rating and both times we've bid on priceline, we got this hotel. The location is great and the rooms are big, but that's about all it has going for it. The bathroom is small. The wall paper in the room is molding and peeling. When we arrived, we were in a super rush to get back out and found a used towel and shower cap left in the bathroom so we didn't have time to wait for service or move to another room. I informed the front desk later, but they but they didn't seem to care. Hotel is currently under renovation and the main lobby and area around the elevators were not appealing

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: jojo2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Montreal for New Year's eve .. What a disapointment .. I had paid a surcharge to be on their Regency Club floor .. According to their website it is supposed to be a private access floor, no guest under the age of 18 and rooms with upgraded amenities .. The 11th floor is no way private, every body can go. The room in front of us had at least 4 teenagers .. The room had poor quality towels, no robes as mentionned on their websites, only 2 glasses for the whole room ..One of the sheet was torn .. The Regency Club lounge is also supposed to be for guest over the age of 18 and the 2 times we went in, it was "loaded" with teenagers and kids .. Not the mention the hectic elevators situation. Due to construction only 2, out of 4, were working .. Really, it felt more like a Comfort Inn than a Hyatt!!! Will I go again, no way, the Queen Elizabeth is way better !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: drlhbl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to head up to Montreal for NYE weekend. We stayed two nights here. The rooms were very nice, clean and spacious. It was pretty convenient. It was connected to a mall/food court that was pretty handy. It is a bit of a walk to the Metro Station, but not a ridiculous hike. Besides, if you are heading to Montreal..walking is the name of the game. It was a bit tricky, because the hotel was under some construction and only 2 of the 4 elevators were operating. This was somewhat inconvenient because the hotel was booked solid. Standing in line with a bunch of luggage isn't the best fun I have ever had. But, sometimes this is the nature of the beast. The service was impeccable. Check in and check out were smooth. The neighborhood around the hotel was a bit shady as it is situated on the corner of Rue St Catherine. I would consider staying here again. However, I found The Fairmont quite a bit more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A_Experiencer_CA
Reviews.Content: We recently passed through Montreal and had a one-night stay at the Hyatt. Really liked the location, walking distance to Notre Dame Basilica and Chinatown. Nice facilities, especially the pool and exercise room. Also liked the direct connections to the underground city for shopping. Very friendly staff. Thought the buffet breakfast was overpriced and nothing special. Comfortable room although on the small side. This place would be even more inviting after the reno is completed.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: FRANKRAFFA
Reviews.Content: I got a PRICELINE deal at the Hyatt for $80 /night. The hotel was incredible and is nicely located above a big mall. The Hyatt would be my first stop in any other stay here in Montreal. The room was huge with a queen bed and there was a refrigerator and lovely desk on which I could work. The staff never once answered in English when I spoke French to them. There is a daily internet fee (12.95-ripoff) but if you join the Hyatt rewards, it may be free. The best was when I had breakfast in the restaurant. It was the most incredible buffet that I have ever seen. Incredible service from FRIENDLY folks and a choice that would satisfy any appetite. STAY AT THIS HOTEL, if you can. Frankraffa@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Convient location in downtown montreal”
Reviews.Author: mountainhiker
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby is indoor construction, but we had no difficulty navigating in and out of the hotel. We were in a club floor room on the 10th floor and heard no construction noise. Exercise room is excellent -- free weights and bench, several exercise machines and treadmills. Pool area looked lovely as well. As for club floor amenities, club lounge has free continental breakfast -- bagels, pastures, cereal, coffee, tea, soda, juice -- coffee, tea and soda all day with cookies in the afternoon. Evening it has appetizers and reduced price drinks (wine = $ 4.00 per glass) 5:00 to 7:30. Hotel in on rue St Catherine good for shopping and it connects directly to underground shopping area. Not a long walk to old Montreal. Rooms do need a face lift but ours was comfortable. Room wifi $12.95 per day but included in club room price. If you can get a cheaper than normal rate it is a fine place to stay even with the renovations ongoing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away until after renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: spagirlToronto
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to a weekend away with no kids and time to sleep in. Not a chance at this hotel. Not only is construction going on inside the hotel, but our rooms overlooked an area under construction. Drilling and hammering began early Sat. and Sunday morning. Only one elevator for the whole hotel was working. We ended up having to take the stairs (along with other guests) as the wait for the elevator was very long. We left for the day Sat. and came back at dinner time to find our room key no longer worked. After a huge hassle (they didn't believe it was our room) we were finally let in, only to find that the room hadn't been cleaned. We had to sit in our friends room and wait for ours to be cleaned. We wanted to go to old Montreal for dinner but it is too far to walk, especially when it is cold and snowing. We had to take a cab there and back. There is a mall attached but there are not many stores in the mall. We had drinks in the hotel after our dinner out and they were very expensive - 4 drinks- $80. No entertainment or atmosphere - the bar is right in the lobby. Our room was very dated and had peeling wallpaper and water damage in the bathroom. At check-out time there was a huge line up at the registration desk and only 2 people to deal with everyone. Considering the vast number of hotels in Montreal, I would suggest selecting a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated room nice but nothing fancy for 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulela
Reviews.Content: There's a temp reception that looks like 2 tradeshow booths given the reno's still going on in the main lobby. The front desk indicated all rooms were renovated. The one I got on the 4th floor seemed decent but not amazing. Better than a pig with lipstick but there were still traces of the old decor. The flatscreen in the rm is nice. The detours to get from the temp Reception make it somewhat confusing for 1st time visitors. Loved the mall and it restos on the ground floor and underground levels. Finally, I recommend the swimming pool and the Steamroom - beautiful, tastefully designed and enjoyable. Overall service was friendly and helpful. Maybe it was the mid-week Staff? :)

Reviews.Title: “what an amazing suite”
Reviews.Author: annemaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Once the renovation is over, I am convinced this hotel will be a hot spot in town, the suite I got was absolutely amazing, comfortable, with a great fire place, view over the Theatre area, I attended a conference and loved the meeting space with great coffee

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: ritzycat
Reviews.Content: Finally left this hotel today following a week stay for a convention. Firstly, the hotel is going through renovation and every part of the hotel reeks of the construction mess. The entrance is confusing, there are no automatic doors to help you with your luggage, 3 bellman standing around that refuse to acknowledge your arrival, a front desk which also would require you fall over for some attention by the staff...just overall a poor welcome into the hotel. More disappoint follows when you enter your room. Outdated rooms with very poor lighting, awkward bathrooms that have questionable stains on the floor (I brought flip-flops), extremely slow room service...just overall an awful stay. Many colleagues stayed in other nearby hotels...that's what I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, great location and will be even better when it is finished!”
Reviews.Author: Calina2502
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for a one-night visit to Montreal. Though the 7 of us were only there less than 24hours we were able to experience most of what the Hyatt had to offer. The parking situation, especially being a weekend, was a little confusing. We had parked on P3 and though it wasn't overly difficult to find the hotel through the mall, it was a touch harder to find the correct elevator to get to our car the next day. Leave a trail of breadcrumbs, or bring a GPS, lol... There are a few elevators to get into the mall area, make note of which elevator you use to make a quick getaway. Our 2 rooms were booked via Expedia's new Hotwire feature. We didn't know where we would be staying, just that it would be a 3.5star or better and in the downtown area. We were pleasantly surprised upon learning which hotel we had booked, due to the location. Very close to St.Catherine and within walking distance to the Eaton Centre. We inquired on checking in if there was any possibility of an upgrade, and our very helpful and friendly receptionist Eric was able- the rooms we had booked were on a lower floor, with no fridges, getting 9th floor and fridge was top notch. The room itself(942) had a great city view, but the curtains were really wonky and hard to open due to this, only one of the 2 was able to open completely, the other was blocked by sheers. Beds were firm but also soft, hard to describe. Room was well equipped, well furnished and the coffee and tea provided were very much appreciated. The mall below the hotel has a decent sized food court and a good number of stores to shop in including a super-market which was really handy. Can buy wine, beer and coolers there in addition to regular grocery items. The pool was an oasis, pack your swimsuit! Very friendly and well-placed pool staff, with their view of the pool unobstructed and direct- would be great for families. The area itself was great to lounge around in, we even got some sun on a cool November afternoon! I would recommend bringing a magazine or good book to this area and a cup of tea, you will feel like you are at a resort! I am already planning on returning and taking advantage of the massage services there, very relaxing area.

Reviews.Title: “French efficiency with English Charm”
Reviews.Author: PeterGoodchild
Reviews.Content: This hotel is atop a shopping center and a Metro stop, which makes it convenient for some travel but most unlike other Hyatts. One must ascend from the shopping center on level 2 or 3 to level 6, where one finds most of the lobby area under construction. The staff is civil but not friendly in general. After checking in one is directed to a hidden elevator hall up five narrow steps, half of which are occupied by a ramp for wheeled luggage or adventurous wheel chair pilots. The hotel elevators take one to the upper floors numbered from 1 to 12, which is initially confusing because you are entering from level 6. I was on the first floor. There were stairs, but they were definitely suited for emergencies only. You could access the foyer level after scrambling down metal stairs for 6 flights from the first floor, but otherwise you had to exit at street level. While there were some compensations in the fact that there were five elevators, they were often crowded when going down from the upper floors. An ATM is available next to the hotel desk, but I would recommend going down to level 3 of the shopping center for free service to save the $2.50 fee that the hotel charges on its ATM. If you eat at the food court, you will save a good deal. The breakfast buffet was $25 CAN.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good stay ..but..”
Reviews.Author: Slysaint
Reviews.Content: I was there for just for laughs festival, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, but i still do not understand why one has to pay for internet, I am sure the hotel can do without the $12 just to make the customers happy. Other than that, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinaybansal
Reviews.Content: its a good property of hyatt chain in montreal, but little confusing abt the hotel entrance and then to room elevator, note its very comfortable abt everything, in basement you will find foodcourt, on 3rd floor there is shopping and a very good resturant with big bar table , sorry i forget the name, but pl. must visit this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff, pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: JKozDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at the Hyatt Regency Montreal at the beginning of September 2010. A local film festival was wrapping up so the lobby seemed especially busy during our stay, but nothing that the staff didn't handle. Check-in was very smooth and our room was as described and very comfortable. Room cleaning staff was great and always left the extra towels and coffee that we requested. I think they also made a note in their system about our requests, because there was a different cleaning person one morning and she already knew what we needed. That's excellent customer service in my opinion.The room was quiet and spacious enough for four adults. There was some sort of construction going on, but we could only hear it when down in the lobby. Maybe lower rooms would have been able to hear it, but we were on the ninth floor and not affected by the noise. The location of the hotel is great for a first-time visit to Montreal. The hotel is above a huge shopping mall that has a food court, grocery store and direct underground access to the metro (Place des Arts stop) and a great location on the metro as far as ease of transferring to other lines goes. The food court in the mall below has a nice variety of fast-service restaurants, although be aware that some close fairly early. The location was central to downtown shopping, Old Montreal and the Quays of the Old Port. Staying in Old Montreal may be fun as it is extrememly charming, but staying closer to downtown was less expensive at this time of year. I really thought the Hyatt Regency was an excellent choice for us and it suited all our needs, as I believe it would for anyone visiting Montreal and wishing to see all the major tourist attractions. I also cannot compliment the staff enough. Everyone was very friendly, spoke very good English, and was eager to help. Being able to exchange money at the front desk was very convenient as well. Thank you for a wondergul stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: HWO
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my four day stay at the Hyatt. I arrived by train at Gare Centrale and walked to the hotel. It is also walking distance from Centreville, Chinatown, Vieux Montreal and Vieux Port. The hotel has underground access to the subway system via the Desjardins Mall. The mall has a food court and an IGA. I found the front desk staff to be very helpful. I had no problems with the roomâ€™s cleanliness, but it took about five minutes to get hot water out of the bathroom faucet. My room did not have a safe or fridge. While I think itâ€™s a stretch to rate this a four star hotel, itâ€™s certainly worth consideration at a discounted rate (Hotwire, Priceline etc). I would stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here. Great Location, very nicely outfitted.”
Reviews.Author: DeviousTA
Reviews.Content: My family and I (wife and 3 yo daughter) stayed here for 3 nights to visit family and tour Montreal. We found the hotel very clean and had an excellent location. Most things we wanted to visit were within a short walk away, and it also is attached to a mall with stores, a grocery store, food court etc so lots of options very close by. We had breakfast at Eggspectations that was also attached and it was perfect. Spent a few hours in the pool which from prior posts has revised their hours (it was 6am to 10pm with 2 short 30 minute breaks for the lifeguard to have some food). They were so occomodating that we arrived at the pool at 11am just as he was about to go on break, and instead of asking us to come back, a plate was brought out for the lifeguard and we didn't have to leave at all. Our room had a new LCD, and a safe. There was also the option of self-park or valet (I refuse valet after a very bad experience elsewhere). The only things I could possibly recommend (and I think at least some are coming) is I'm not particularly fond of paying for internet ($13/day) -- I fortunately knew this in advance and had a rocket stick and was able to tether my blackberry. This is apparently customary in a 4+ star but its still a shocker. I also would have loved a little fridge -- easy for keeping food for a little one. Other than that a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Necessary renovations are underway - will cleanliness be addressed?”
Reviews.Author: Biensapeau
Reviews.Content: About your reviewer: I am much more concerned about the quality of a restaurant than the quality of a hotel, for the simple reason that I care more about what I eat than about my surroundings. Give me a shoddy room and Iâ€™ll not likely say anything, but feed me a bad meal and you may have an enemy for life. In short, it would take a very bad experience for me to complain to the hotel administration. For your consideration in assessing this review. The hotel is a mess, inside and out. They canâ€™t do anything about the construction outside, and they are trying to fix the problems inside, hence the renovation. I donâ€™t know whether the complicated entry procedure is due to the renovation disruption or whether it is always this way, but you need to take two elevators to get to a room. The location is ideal, close to the metro and major bus lines. It is attached to a mall and business complex. Many of the major attractions, including le Vieux Port (the old port), are within walking distance. Upon check-in, we hit our first glitch when advised that there were no rooms with king beds available although this is what we had paid for (not merely reserved, but purchased). When I explained that we were celebrating a special occasion, the desk agent did what she had to and found us an acceptable room, which was very much appreciated. When I am on holiday, Iâ€™m not of a mind to inspect a hotel room with an eye to finding fault. Itâ€™s a vacation, after all, not a forensic investigation. However, I was taken aback to find clumps of long, dark, hair throughout the bathroom. This wasnâ€™t a matter of a small oversight; weâ€™re talking about hair in the tub, hair around the tub and hair on the walls. Since something this obvious was overlooked, I questioned whether the rest of the bathroom had been cleaned at all. The rooms are three-star quality. They are not large. Our room was similar in design and size to the Delta Chelsea in Toronto, but this is likely the pre-renovation style. Although we were on the third floor, we didnâ€™t hear the outside construction. We did not have a safe, fridge or bathrobes in our room. The bed was comfortable. We had no difficulty with the climate controls. On the second night, we came home to find that a snack had been left in our room. This was a thoughtful gesture, but since I am allergic to two of the main ingredients, the smell was a problem for me. Nevertheless, it showed that hotel management was making an effort. We tried twice to check out via the television, but did not receive confirmation that it had worked. I would not likely stay at this property again unless the post-renovation price is comparably low and the service issues noted by other reviewers are remedied.

Reviews.Title: “Don't turn up late”
Reviews.Author: Biggs426
Reviews.Content: I was travelling across Canada in a party of seven, and we chose to stay here for two nights in Montreal. This lovely hotel was totally let down by the service at the front desk. On arrival around 10pm, after a day of travelling, the rooms we had booked were not available. They then tried to squeeze seven of us into three rooms by putting additional beds on the floor. We got a discount as compensation, but even this couldn't be arranged and by 4am we were getting very cross indeed. In the end we got a full refund. Our booked rooms were finally provided for the second night, but it put a real damper on the holiday. I'd only book here if you're able to check in early in the day. Oh, and allow a good ten minutes for the lifts to get you between your room and the foyer. Some positive notes: - the breakfast is wonderful, including freshly made omelettes - the pool and steam room is lovely and worth a visit - the rooms (once obtained!) are clean, comfortable, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Service-lite with tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: juntemada
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days pre-cruise. Access to check in from the taxi was complicated and difficult.Only one person occupied the front desk,so it took thirty minutes from taxi to room. The room was without safe or fridge, but included the previous guests towels in the bathroom.We booked a room with better view, but needed to have the window cleaned inside to see out properly. The only consolation was a well presented breakfast room .

Reviews.Title: “don' stay there unless ...”
Reviews.Author: mkindler
Reviews.Content: you the average hyatt fulfills your needs because this is the typical 3* hyatt. old building with ultra low ceilings, poor taste in decoration, old bathrooms. everything is just the way it is not supposed to be. the hotel is currently under renovation but i am not sure that is going to change a lot. we can only advise not to stay there. it is boring, very american even so it is in canada with lots of noisy groups and not so nice people.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: LolaAsucena
Reviews.Content: The room was fine on face value and sleep quality, but it was becoming shabby. The bathroom had cracks, peeling, loose door handles and horrible towels. There were rough slats on the ceiling in the entrance to the room. I have no idea why the ceiling was unfinished. The maid didn't remove used glasses or used hotel toiletry items. The food at breakfast and lunch was absolutely horrible - overcooked, wrong item, inedible. There has to be better places to stay in Montreal, particularly at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Still nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan
Reviews.Content: I last reviewed the Hyatt Regency following our 2 day stay there in the Spring. We again were booked into this hotel after a Priceline.com bid of $95 a night for a standard double room. My positive review of the hotel remains. It is centrally located and attached to Complexe Desjardins, a large shopping and office complex, with plenty of stores and restaurants, including a large food court and supermarket. This time, we used the fitness centre; it was first rate. Also, contrary to the last visit, our room now had a flat screen TV. All in all, a positive stay, especially for the priceline price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMax99
Reviews.Content: Yes, it was really nice and I loved the location - right smack dab in the middle of Saint Catherine's...but expensive! And for all the money we paid, they charged us approx. $14 a day for wireless internet , and $1 per local phone call (I know, not big $$ but just kind of annoying when your already paying enough for the room...) - not cool! But I'd have to put the comfortableness of the bed's at the absolute top of the scale - it was hard to get up some mornings they were so darn comfortable lol

Reviews.Title: “No problems here. Great Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hyatt Regency Montreal was a fine one. The hotel is located in a prefect location. You are right above stores / restaurants / subway (metro) access. The rooms are clean and modern. The bathroom was a bit small but very clean. Staff was great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mghai
Reviews.Content: I had no problems at this hotel. The beds were comfortable and it was in a good location, walking distance to old Montreal. The A/C worked. We enjoyed the pool facilities. We got a good deal using Priceline thus making it an incredible value. Internet was not free though.

Reviews.Title: “good location decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfdudedad
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nites through priceline. Handy spot, clean friendly responsive. I would stay here again. Can't believe they want 13 bucks for wifi, but as another traveller noted there is a starbucks across the street with wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Rubberman542
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel and were pretty happy with it but it was definitely not a 4 star experience Overall we were happy with our room, it was clean and the beds were comfortable, but while the pool area (which includes a sauna and steam room which were quite nice) and the lobby and bar were beautiful and modern the rooms and hallways themselves are showing there age. We were confused to hear the girl at the front desk brag to us that they were going to be spending $5 million in the next year to renovate the lobby area when it's the only part of the hotel that didn't need it. The majority of the hotel staff were all professional and very courteous and helpful, except for at the front door where they seemed to be too interested in chatting amongst themselves to acknowledge any of the guests. The hotel advertises itself as a 4 star but I would rate it a 3 at best, there were some things missing in our room that I have never been without in a 4 star.... no full length mirror, no safe, no fridge. For the price we payed we enjoyed our stay here but would have been quite angry if we had payed the full price I think.

Reviews.Title: “Split personality - great location, nice rooms, creepy and dingy hallways”
Reviews.Author: hankstamper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right near the shopping of St. Catherine, across from the art museum and above some shopping. There's construction now, but it wasn't a big problem. You have to take two elevators to get to your rooms, and, in our case, walk down a dark hallway with peeling wallpaper and old brown carpet -- definitely not a 4-star experience. The room was small, but fine, and the health club and pool were beautiful, clean and modern. It just seemed like an outdated hotel where a few things were fixed to maintain a luxury facade, and the rest left about three decades behind the renovation cycle.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fantastic”
Reviews.Author: trigeekgirl236
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Montreal was, at its core, just another hotel. There was nothing spectacularly good about it, but also nothing that would make me advise that everyone avoid it on pain of something or other. The elevators are slow, especially the one from the street level to the lobby. Hint: take the elevator in the shopping complex next door. The internet is $12.95/day for slow internet, which in this day and age is pretty much highway robbery. A room service tray sat outside a room on my floor for a full 48 hours before anyone bothered to actually go get it. There's no hot tub, which would have been REALLY nice after a long day of wandering around the city. On the other hand, the staff were helpful and responsive and the location is central to both the McGill area, the Downtown Montreal area, Old Montreal, and the Latin quarter. I walked everywhere without an issue. I appreciated the shopping center next to the hotel for its facilities and options to connect to public transport. The Starbucks across the street has free Wi-Fi, as does the shopping center. Overall? Just another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent experience.”
Reviews.Author: jcoafamily
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing within walking distance of old city and downtown attractions. Friendly service, clean facilities. Above shopping center. Only complaint is that Internet should be part of room service in a hotel of Hyatt's reputation. Parking is pricey at $30 day.

Reviews.Title: “overall OK, a typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AndyNogger
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was situated in the midst of the Jazz Festival which was great. Attached to the Hotel is a Shopping Mall with relevant shops and a small food mall. China Town is within easy walking distance. The rooms are OK but overall the Hotel is not the newest and the corridors need some renovation. Food in the restaurant was good, The receptionist obviously had a bad day and was very short with helping remarks as to which restaurant to recommend for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: teera12
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and was very happy with our stay. Quiet, modern room with a very comfortable king sized bed and tons of soft pillows. The parking was a little confusing. There were two entrances....the first was self park for $10 for 24hours and the second entrance was hotel Valet for around $30. Check-in was fast and smooth and any hotel staff we passed by in the hallways were all friendly. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel itself but just needed a place to sleep. Served us well. Was just a few blocks walk to old montreal where we spent the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but hotel needs updates (especially the bathrooms)”
Reviews.Author: smsgr8
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It is right next to the Museum of contemporary arts and the area is lined with lots of shops and its proximity to Eaton Center helps as well. The hotel is connected to Desjardins complex which has a big mall within as well as lots of small eateries. The hotel itself does not have a restaurant. The rooms were small but ok, lighting was very bad and the rooms were very dim even with all the lights on. The bathrooms seriously need updating. The vanity mirror has no light around it and the dim light in the bathroom made it tough for my wife to use the mirror in there. The tubs look old and so do the sink and commode. Any noise outside is heard including the music playing often at the bar level of the hotel itself. Room service was excellent and spot on. Valet service is recommended as the cars are parked in the Desjardins lot next door and it is not as convenient to do it yourself. TV Checkout was painful as it was in FRENCH. I would assume more outside visitors use the hotel (so maybe English should be an option) Overall a decent hotel but as someone else said .. more of a 3 star (and wont be a 4 till bathrooms are updated).

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: jtyler
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel in 6 years. The level of service has definitely gone downhill. On the plus side the hotel has great location. It is within walking distance to great shopping and Old Town. But it was not a great stay for us. I requested a quiet room on their web site when I made the reservation. When we arrived, I asked again if they had given us a quiet room as the film festival was going on right outside the hotel. We were assured that the room was quiet. After being in the room for 15 minutes we could tell that the noise from the street festival was going to be unbearable even though we were 9 floors up and half a block from it. We requested to change rooms but the front desk said the hotel was at 100% occupancy and we could not change. We toughed out the noise (Which was incredibly loud!). The next morning, I went to the desk to request a room change to a room away from the noise. It seemed as if they must always get this request because the person at the front desk did not ask any questions. He wrote down our room number and told me that they would move our bags during the day. After getting back to the room that night, we found that they had put our bags in storage but had not reserved us another room. After waiting an hour at the desk while they moved things around, they gave us a room only to find out that the room they gave us was going to be even louder than the room the previous night. After another lengthy wait at the desk, they did find an inside room for us. That room was incredibly smoky even though it was supposed to be non-smoking, but it was quiet. We have previously stayed at the Hilton and would probably stay there again, but not the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Traveler, not sure about Family Friendly”
