Reviews.Author: Peter-From-NJ
Reviews.Content: Unloading of luggages from a long road trip was met by unfriendly Vallet Service who gave a nose-up and cold shoulder when we refused the service. We had to struggle unloading ourselves. Eh! Even a helping hand from a porter could have helped. None to be found. Guest services also very cold and un-enviting. Great for a business traveler who just wants to get into and out of Montreal. Wonderful pool, when quiet. Not so for us. Pool was noisy with pre-paid events for non-guests who danced and played loud pounding music for hours on end. The headache and aggrivation was free. I'm sure there was a good reason for the party. Money. Again, great if you are a business traveler and are familiar with the party sene. At this party, it was all gay men. So, not sure if very young children were educated with the homosexual sene. Parents had no choice if they wanted to use the pool. Stuck. Money rules, you know. As for managers supervisory control of the gay men in the women's locer - no such thing. The hotel must have been ready for complaints. Making provisions for guests unknown of the noise. We were offered a $5 coupon for such disturbance. Not sure if $5 covers it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Despite Some Harsh Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Indiechat
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel after bidding $95 on priceline for a 4 star hotel for an overnight shopping trip. When reading the reviews here, I was worried. It was not bad at all, but I can see why people complained. This hotel is an excellent 3 or 3.5 star hotel, but there are little things that affect its impression as a 4 star hotel. All of the decor is new and stylish, but carpets in heavily used areas simply need a steam cleaning. They look trampled. The elevators to the rooms (4) are painfully slow and their timing does not make sense. If you are on a high floor budget for 5 minutes extra time each way to come and go on your trip. The set of elevators from the parking level to reception are brass finish, but they were not polished during my stay. They looked really dirty and you did not want to touch them. Funny, the hotel should give them some TLC, because that is the main entrance for most people and the first impression of the hotel. The bathrooms were fine and clean but the tubs and tile are not what you would normally see in a 4 star hotel. However, my room was very comfortable -- beds and linens were great. Flat screen TV. I had a great sleep. This hotel is in an excellent location for shopping and site seeing. Starbucks and Dairy Queen across the street and excellent food court selection attached to the hotel at Place Desjardins. Also a Baton Rouge and Eggspectations accessible from the hotel. I found staff friendly. I did not bring my computer, so I did not need WiFi on this trip. I would not like to pay for it though. When booking on Priceline, it's a great find---but I would not pay full rack rate. It's not of the quality of the Hyatt hotels I've been to in the States. Nor does it compare to the Fairmont QE, which also is a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: viajes001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and in a great location. The rooms are a little dated but they were clean. The beds were comfortable but not the best I have seen in a hotel. I liked the fact that I could not hear noise from the neighboring rooms. Self parking is at the garage of the adjacent mall but the elevator will take you to the hotel lobby. Self parking is 19 CAD a day during the week and 10 CAD on the weekend. They only have a concierge sometimes and they do not have city brochures out which I think they should. There is a mall adjacent to the hotel that has a grocery store which is convenient for snacks and drinks. As previously mentioned the internet is not free and is pricey. I spent about $20 USD for an average of about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night”
Reviews.Author: modernwilla
Reviews.Content: We won a night at this hotel and our stay was amazing. The pillows were a little too fluffy, and the corners in the shower would need a little cleaning, but otterwise, it was perfect. The breakfast brunch downstairs is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: dsmitty_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 30-July 3 during the Jazz Festival. Couldnâ€™t have asked for a closer proximity to the music. The balcony at the pool level overlooked the festivities. We were able enjoy the music whilst swimming. There was a small bar on the patio so you could climb out of the pool and enjoy a cocktail and take in the whole scene. The pool was open until 10 pm, so this was never an issue. The rooms were modest but clean. Canâ€™t wait to do it again next year. D Smith

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are going to the Jazz Festival, otherwise not.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinMadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel during the Jazz Festival although in town for business meetings. It is an ideal location for the festival as you are right in the middle of it. As far as the hotel, it is average as far as the rooms. I was not impressed with the service, there was always a line up at the front desk and often only 2 people attending. I once had to redo my room key and stood in line for over 20 minutes. Ordering room service often meant leaving a message and getting a call back in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. But, that's the best feature.....”
Reviews.Author: viceversa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using Hyatt points. Our stay was from June 10 - June 14, while we attended the Formula 1 race. The location of this property is excellent. We couldn't have asked for a better location, close to the subway stations, restaurants, etc., all within easy walking distance. Upon arrival, we found that the reception is reached by taking an elevator up a few flights. No big deal. Unimpressive lobby, and it was clear that this hotel is in need of refreshing. Check in was smooth, and the font desk staff was helpful, courteous and professional. Then, we got to our room.... The bedroom itself was OK - clean, well made up and comfortable. It was, however, just as dated as the lobby. No fridge (available at extra cost), old tube-style televisions, and poor WiFi reception. But it was the bathroom that was absolutely disgusting. The paint on the ceiling was peeling, there was black mold where the shower wall met the ceiling, the wallpaper was peeling on the walls near the sink, and the sink itself was clogged. I suspect the paint/wallpaper, mold issues may be due to the fact that the bathroom ventilating fan was inoperative. On the way out that night, I informed the front desk that our drain was clogged and we'd be heading out for the evening. She was going to have someone fix it immediately. It didn't happen, as we noticed when we returned. Another request in the morning, and it was fixed later that afternoon. I spent tens of thousands of Hyatt points for this room. Perhaps they give non-paying customers the substandard rooms; I hope that's not the case. FYI, I am a convention planner, and I know what's important and what can be looked past. In its current state and from my personal experience, I would not recommend this hotel. To be fair, I contacted Hyatt after returning home and they refunded one nights worth of Hyatt points. Pluses: the location, as mentioned. Also, the hotel connects to a large mall with good restaurant choices. Easy walking distance to 2 subway stops.

Reviews.Title: “No Fluff, But Great Basics"”
Reviews.Author: L2T22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location at which to stay for the Montreal Jazz Festival. Located in the midst of the festivities, the hotel staff couldn't have been nicer (except for the snooty bartender in main lobby.) Beds were incredibly comfortable - one of the best mattresses I've ever slept on. Pillows were terrific as well. The rooms don't have any of the "extras," such as make-up mirror, cotton balls, Q-tups or magazines in the room, but the basics were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here..everything is extra charge!”
Reviews.Author: bichter
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Hyatt Regency's before,but this is by far the worst!High speed internet....$12.95 a day for a poor connection!Parking $30 a day.Wanted to send a bottle of wine and some cheese to our room comp when they discovered our check in date was my wifes big 50,but when the "gift" arrvied they wanted charge us for it!And so on..........................

Reviews.Title: “Bring a fist full of money”
Reviews.Author: yooperscooper
Reviews.Content: At hotel for a conference so the rate was OK, room was fine, it is the other costs that were unreasonable. Buffet breakfast for 2 was $50CDN. Go around the corner to Eggspectations and get a superior order breakfast for half the price for 2. Then it was getting boarding passes printed. Any US chain, even the bargain chains, have free internet and printing in a business center. Internet was $12.95CDN a day, not unreasonable but unnecessary for a higher class establishment. To log on in the business center is $5CDN minimum, first try to print boarding passes was unsuccessful. On second $5 try, they printed at a cost of $1 per B&W page. Total to print boarding passes for 2 people was $16. OK, do it at the airport.....but for a higher class hotel this seems more than a bit too much. The plus is that the hotel is at the underground mall, not nearly as impressive as Toronto but acceptable. Even though the recommendation is thumbs up, it is with reluctance.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY,RUDE STAFF,NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: xbarbiie
Reviews.Content: The stay was horrible to begin with. The room was booked via Priceline. Once I received the confirmation via Priceline, I contacted Hyatt to request a King size bed in a smoking room. I understand requests are just that and may not be available. However, check in was at 3 pm. I arrived at 2:45pm and the concierge told me they were all booked up. After 30 minutes they finally found my confirmation, claiming along the way they never found it. My request was not granted and I specifically told them, if I am going to be paying this outrageously high price, I better receive what I have requested. They claim the request was never in the system and all smoking rooms have been booked up by residents arriving at 8 am. I though check in was a strict 3 pm, apparently not here. After 45 minutes of arguing back and forth she still would not give me a room I requested. I told her then to upgrade me to a higher end non smoking room if she is going to inconvenience me to such an extent. After numerous dirty remarks in French, she complied. The room was tiny, dingy, dark and dirty. The drinking cups had previous usersâ€™ stains on them. The sheets were crimpled; clearly they have not been changed. There was peeling wallpaper. After sleeping on these sheets, my partners developed body rashes all over his back, a clear sign of dirty sheets. I am disgusted with this hotel. I want my money back. This is outrageous. I will make sure to let everyone know, to never visit Hyatt Regency Montreal or any other Hyatt establishment ever again. A 2 start motel will never treat you with such disgust and disrespect as a supposed 4 star Hyatt did. They have no respect for people let alone people who donâ€™t speak French. I want my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself is a bit dated & dirty, focusing on the business/convention traveller, but location is good”
Reviews.Author: miiamiia
Reviews.Content: Location - 15 minute walk to center of old town which we did often and didn't mind, more convenient for the convention center and the main tourist drag of St. Catherines. Decor - brownish and dirty, could use a face lift, but functional Service - front desk always seemed to have a line, breakfast service just OK Bottom line - a business focused hotel, but if you're not spending much time in the room or at the hotel this is an adequate option Value - we got a good weekend rate, therefore we thought it was a good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Not at full price!”
Reviews.Author: Canaanite01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed three times at the Hyatt Regency, We had booked through Hotwire or Priceline each time. Each time I said to my partner/spouse, if we had paid full price, i'd be upset. The hotel is in a great location, part of a complex that includes shopping, food court, casual restaurants, Place des Arts and access to the Metro. Chinatown, Old Montreal, and downtown are all but a short walk away. Downsides: High price for valet parking, $7.50 per day for WIFI, no conceriege service nor a restaurant like what expect at this star/price level. At full price, this is not an option. Last visit was $75USD through priceline

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Hyatt Regency in Montreal. I read the negative reviews of this establishment and, frankly, I do not think they were justified. We had a large room, it was spotless. The elevators functioned well. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was clean and in good shape. The staff was friendly, although I must admit that, being former Montrealers, we know the city and did not call upon the hotel's personnel for much in the way of guidance. We checked out (but did not use) the fitness centre and pool. They were very nice. We arrived on a Friday night and left Sunday. In this regard, we were able to take advantage of the weekend parking special offered by the neighbouring Complexe Desjardins, the large shopping centre that the hotel is a part of. When we pulled up to the parking, we were given two options; valet parking operated by the hotel, with unlimited in and out privleges for $30 nightly. Or, if we preferred, we could use the parking lot operated by the shopping centre (which is a connected to the hotel's lot and has an entrance to the hotel directly from the parking) for $10 nightly. As we would not be going in and out, we chose the later. On the negative side, yes, the furniture and decor were a bit dated. The television was not a new, flat screen and the bathroom was a bit dark. We did not use the food services of the hotel. Rather, we ate breakfast at the food court in the Complexe Desjardins shopping centre. This review is entitled "nice for the price" for a reason. We secured the reservation using a bid to Priceline. The price was very reasonable. If I was required to pay the full rack rate, I am not so sure my recommendation would be so effusive. But, for the price, it indeed was a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated - services don't match prices”
Reviews.Author: JohnM99
Reviews.Content: Not a very impressive hotel for the prices - outdated rooms, TV looked 20 years old, room service hours very limited (closed 11:30 pm, only opens at 6:30) - you would kind of expect 24 hr room service - or at least be able to get a coffee at 6 am. It was OK, but very expensive for simple things like restaurant coffees, internet $13 and kind of slow. I am not fussy about decor, but really hideous hallway decorations - even I noticed that. (did they actually pay somebody to decorate the hallways, or just get the ugliest they could find?). Air con is quiet - that is the main thing that would differentiate this from a cheap Comfort Inn type place, frankly. To get from the entrance to the lobby you have to wait for the slowest 2 elevators I have taken in years (badly adjusted - they take a long time to actually stop) - 20 minutes to get from the taxi to the lobby - and no possibility of taking the stairs. You can do a LOT better in Montreal. I think they live off their conference trade. Would never choose it otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the steam room”
Reviews.Author: chefstir
Reviews.Content: Good and bad with this hotel, the good...Our room was very clean, great steam room and gym facilities, nice common area's, excellent check in, directly connected to underground city, walking distance to chinatown, st catherines street and old montreal. The bad...have to pay for wifi, the beds and linens are 2 to 3 star quality, outdated TV, poor in room coffee setup, and dont call room service, I called for a wine opener and 2 wine glasses and was told there was none in the hotel, I thought the man was joking and laughed, the guy was then outright aggressive and rude with me...WOW...! I called front desk, they apologized and sent right away.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but location not great and no character at all”
Reviews.Author: bblainey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt for a quick 2 day visit to Montreal with our kids (10 & 13). The hotel is decent but unmemorable. It is a brick edifice extending the Desjardins shopping centre. The rooms are basic and the service was efficient if impersonal. We got the room cheap ($100) so we`re fairly satisfied with the value but I would not pay much more to stay here. One annoyance was that the pool hours are ridiculous (10am-6pm) - seemingly designed to avoid usage by either business or leisure travelers. The location is not great, especially for families. It is an easy walk from the hotel to Old Montreal or to the St Laurent or St Denis shopping districts but the hotel is located in the middle of a fairly ugly neighbourhood. Exiting the neighbourhood by foot, we were confronted by drunks on St Catherine, some scary looking characters on lower St Laurent and what looks like a bombed out block in north Chinatown. By the look of all the reconstruction happening all around the hotel, there is a serious attempt by the city to clean some of this up but it may take years before the neighbourhood is transformed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room service at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: ki855montreal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent the weekend at the Hyatt and my feelings are mixed. The common areas are renovated, lovely and modern. The rooms have been somewhat renovated, almost everything except the bathtub which is too shallow to really take a nice bath in. Then again who would want to when the fixtures seem to be original and old. The staff is very nice and accommodating, never had to wait to check in or out. We stayed on the club floor, they had cereals, croissants, muffins etc for breakfast, cookies to snack on during the day and a couple appetizer in the evening. We check in around 7pm Friday, brought our bags upstairs and rushed down to get some snack since we were starved. The paper handed to us when we checked in said that there was food being served in the lounge until 9pm. After we rushed down there was nothing, we asked the gentleman working there and he said that the paper was wrong that there was nothing after 8pm, disappointing. We needed to go to the front desk for another reason and mentioned this, they apologized and gave us a bag with chips, water and a granola bar. It was a nice gesture but it would have been nicer if the snacks weren't expired by a month. Since it was late by then we decided to order room service even though the pieces were high we were "treating" ourselves that weekend and we got married at that hotel and knew the food was good. We ordered the onion soup, salad, chicken with sage and the veal which was the special of the day. When it arrived less than 30 minutes later it seemed good. We started with the soup and salad, the soup was the best I've ever had and would definitely order it again! The salad was good also. The we were ready to eat the main course, after a bite or two I realized they had given me chicken with mushroom sauce, the exact same sauce as on my husband's veal. I called them to let them know they made a mistake, instead of fixing it the gentleman on the phone told me that i ordered the chicken and mushroom and that that he confirmed it with me, i said there's no way i ordered that but he said he wouldn't fix it for me, i was peeved! I had to pay for something I didn't order and didn't like! The sauce was gross and the chicken had an artificial "grilled" taste. My husband's veal was no better, it looked processed not an actual piece of veal, I've had better microwave dinners. When you're paying 100$ for room service you expect more especially from a 4 star hotel. Thank god I didn't try the room service food before the wedding because I never would have had my wedding there! Avoid room service at all costs! The buffet breakfast was OK, less choices than a year ago. I asked the Waiter if there was any more cheese but they said no, they wouldn't be refilling it. When I asked for green peppers in my omelet there were none left and the chef couldn't get more, isn't this supposed to be a 4 star hotel? And when you're paying 20$ per person for breakfast they should refill things and make sure they have enough food to last till the end. The breakfast is only open till 11am so not a good option for the younger crowd, we saw a lot of people get turned away around 10:45am but lucky for them there's an Eggspectations right downstairs and I'm sure they won't run out of peppers. The pool area is beautiful! Newly renovated with new chairs and is gorgeous! The pool however could use a good scrub, people actually wrote their names in the filth around the inside of the pool! The pool is only open from 10-6pm and is closed for 1/2 hour so the staff can take a lunch break, give me a break! That is not mentioned anywhere so when we got down in our robes ready to swim and found out we had to wait 20 minutes that was really annoying! The pool is hardly open and they still don't have time to clean it? WOW. There is no hot tub but there is a steam room and sauna but to use it you have to go down to the locker rooms, not great if you like to use both. Parking was easy in the complex desjardin, it cost us 18$ for the whole weekend! Fantastic! If you don't plan to use the hotel facilities then it's a good choice for you especially with the mall attached and the many activities around and if you can get a room for under 100$ then you should take it. I feel like I should like the hotel more but I just don't it's the little things that make it not worth the money, there are other hotels in Montreal that have clean pools and hot tubs with longer hours and better food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/Dated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located basically on the far end of Rue St Catherine West which is the basically the main "entertainment district" street with tons of shopping, restaurants, and nightlife and is accessible to Arts Museum and the metro via underground concourse. Proximity to Old Montreal is also pretty good also with only a few blocks walk, so if you plan on hitting both these areas this is a nice central location. As far as the actual hotel goes it was decent at best for a Hyatt. The overall design of the hotel and rooms are very dated. There is a nice pool and lounge area but unfortunately it was only open from something like 9-5 which is very odd hours. Also the elevators were extremely slow and were usually packed which caused us to have to wait several minutes on multiple occasions to get to/from our room. If you are simply looking for a place to stay that suffices for a couple days and get a good deal this is fine but if you're looking for a more upscale accommodation I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Arrive On Time”
Reviews.Author: nbboy_2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed there while attending a CUPE convention. Was not impressed that after a long flight I was forced to roam the streets of Montreal until it was time to check in. This is the first hotel where this was an issue. With over 500 rooms I can not understand why there would not be at least one room available. The room was nice, and the service after check in was adequate. The location was close to all the places I wanted to visit plus the underground tunnel to the Palace de Congress was appreciated on wet, damp days. I thought the hotel was great besides the fact that I had a long wait to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hyatt but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: My arrival was a bit iffy. They messed up my reservations twice and then gave me the one less desirable. Still the staff was friendly and the hotel very nice. Tv was old but it had all the needed channels. The best part about this hotel was the location- downstairs is the underground mall which if you dont know is a series of giant malls under the city which are all interconnected- one of the giant malls happens to be directly below. It is also really close to old montreal. Self parking was available and is dirt cheap on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay to attend a wedding”
Reviews.Author: ecnyc7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is attractive & well-organized, & staffed by friendly, attentive, helpful people. It is also an incredibly good value for money. My room would cost at least twice the price in NYC. This room, on the top (12th) floor of the hotel was attractive & very well appointed & comfortable. However, this is a 4-star hotel, not a 5-star hotel. So if you're interested in comfort & quality for a reasonable price, this is the place for you. If you absolutely MUST have gigantic bath sheets to dry yourself off, a fluffy terrycloth robe & free slippers, champagne, fruit basket & flowers upon arrival, then you should stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overall solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoulouQC
Reviews.Content: It's sort of a typical big chain hotel built in the 1970's - like a McDonald's in the sense that you know it tastes good but you feel like you should be supporting the Mom and Pop hotel down the street. It was clean, comfortable and the brief interactions we had with the staff were very positive. Wifi was free, which is an added bonus. It's close to lots of things such as the Metro and Montreal's Chinatown, which is always good to find some good and cheap eats. The negatives were the $5 per 20 minute charge for internet in the business centre and the fact that the pool closed at 6:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “not a good location for business travelers or tourists”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: this is a non-descript hotel, pretty much undistinguishable from any of the other chain hotels in the 4*** range. the room was nicely presented, but not exactly clean (the hair in the bathtub certainly wasn't mine). they have a funny way of telling you that they don't care about your needs should those needs in any way inconvenience them. best example: their hotel pool opening hours are from 10 am to 6 pm. so you can't use it before heading into town for work or tourism, and you can't use it after you're back in the evening. completely bizarre. i would take the intercontinental, sheraton, marriott or delta in montreal instead of the hyatt at any time. at least the location is pretty convenient in case you're aiming for the arts venues.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its Age”
Reviews.Author: liquiddemon
Reviews.Content: I had a nice 2 night stay at the Hyatt in Montreal. I won this hotel on priceline and would not roll my eyes if I were to be awarded this hotel again. The best part about this hotel is that it sits atop a very large mall structure so everything you could dream of is a elevator (or two) ride away. It's also conveniently located on the Metro line and Montreal's underground city - a fascinating walk. I was only in town for a couple of days so I didn't really have an opportunity to check out all the hotel's amenities. There was a nice business centre though. It allowed for 10 minutes of free internet time per session before charging - a novel idea to keep those not really doing business off the computers. The bar area was quite impressive although I did not stop for a drink. They had this modern vibe going on from the music to the decor in the common areas - kinda cool and much like my stay at the Hyatt in Vancouver. But ... The hotel is certainly showing its age. While my room and bed were quite nice and the room was plenty spacious enough there were two glaring factors that made all this modern vibe go down the toilet, namely the tub fixtures and the tv. Why on earth these have not been replaced by now I'll never know. The bath fixtures have to be the same from the hotel's originating days ... my guess being the 60s sometime - embarrassing. And the tv was not much better - probably purchased in the 90s sometime. I mean, how much would it cost to purchase these two items on bulk? It would give the room such a lift. Really though those were two minor annoyances. I was quite happy with my stay. The front desk was ultra-charming. Although I was there on a priceline bid (which amounts to a second-class citizen with some hotel stays I've had), the young lady at the front desk set me up with a king-sized bed in the "quietest part of the hotel". I swear it was quiet too. I didn't hear a peep either from agacent rooms, the street, the hall, the elevator, the icemaker ... nothing. Very nice if you're a light sleeper (which I'm not) but it made me feel like a VIP nonetheless. Having my expectations set high with a previous Hyatt stay in Vancouver, this Montreal Hyatt does not compare ... although it was reminiscent. I don't think I'd be happy paying full price for this hotel but I've had worse priceline-bid hotels awarded to me. And the charming front desk makes me give this hotel a thumbs up. p.s. If you are staying at this Hyatt or anywhere near it in downtown Montreal, I'd highly recommend a new restaurant on St-Laurent - Provisions. Reasonably priced, personal service and delicious food. Heck, it's only a few steps from the St-Laurent metro so even if you are not downtown you ought to check it out. There's even a 10% discount kicking around the internet these days ... and that's a 10% discount on food AND wine - *Borat accent* ... very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JonM80
Reviews.Content: Stayed during 3 nights from New Yearâ€™s Eve onwards. Got this hotel on priceline for $70 a night which was a great deal. The main reason anyone should stay at this hotel is location, it is about a 10 minute walk to Eaton Centre. This hotel is definitely does not represent the Hyatt name very well. The majority of reviews youâ€™ll find here are accurate. The hotel is a little dim and it does need some work. Generally speaking it was clean and the room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck - just don't”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: NOT RECOMMENDED. A classic Priceline selection, this aging queen lies in a good neighborhood for Montreal, but the entire property is not befitting of the Hyatt name. Poorly maintained, dark and dank, it shows a total lack of love. The staff tries but generally the entire stay turned out to be charmless. Dim lighting in the room made the mood even spookier for fear of what you weren't seeing. We asked for another room (the first stunk of cigarettes), the second, equally horrid and the clerk advised these were renovated. Not sure what was renovated. Do yourself a favorite, skip this place at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near Metro, restaurants and shops”
Reviews.Author: Merrimack2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, looks to have been completly renovated. The parking garage is convenient and the hotel itself is close to the highway in downtown Montreal - everything was walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby in places but otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: bongo999
Reviews.Content: JUst stayed there for one week and would recommend it. Dont arrive thinking it will be like other Hyatt Hotels around the world becuase it is not 4 or 5 star. The corridoors and exteriors are quite shabby and worn but the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The shower was good and the beds were very comfortable. The reception desk staff were very helpful when needed and the location of the hotel is ideal. People who find it confusing finding the lobby must be crazy as it is very straighforward. All in all, a good comfortable hotel, but unfortunately does not include wireless or breakfast. Wireless is $12.95 per day and breakfast is around $25 a day so its not cheap either. In addition the pool is now closed for around a month. I would however recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: cosmo185
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the city centre, and has a huge mall and metro line underneath. Decent pricing and COMFY beds (Hyatt is known for their great beds). I wish they had a specially priced breakfast buffet available, like I had in their sister-hotel in Denver, but I am still quite happy with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: pc61
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay and the staff were extraordinarily courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: shaz09Toronto
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency in Montreal is a very good hotel. The location was the biggest plus point. It is a very central location and everything like the malls was walking distance from there. The service was good and is a good choice to stay at when you visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive”
Reviews.Author: Nannieboubou
Reviews.Content: The remote battery was dead there was not sufficient wash cloths the bed wa squeeky The service at the desk was rude and snoby The wireless is for a fee A good point were the employees at the garage friendly and helpful I will not go back again it was very desapointing

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located in the heart of Montreal and great service.”
Reviews.Author: vikramjain79
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Montreal is located right in the centre of the city of Montreal. It is well connected to St. Catherine Street which is the main shopping street in Montreal which further connects one to 33 sq. kms of shopping area! The service is great and the room are spacious and comfortable. I highly recommend it to anybody visiting Montreal on business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: nbboy_2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived a couple of hours earlier than check in and were told that we could not check in till 3pm, which was check in time. This was an inconvenience as we had to travel the streets for 2 hours while all we wanted to do was lay down and sleep for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: KimberleyL
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. A little confusing to find the lobby if you park in the Complexe Desjardins... but overall very nice room, great price and awesome view of "Place des Arts".

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the better Hyatts, but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: Location wise, the Hyatt is front and center to Place des Arts, which is usually ground zero for the Jazz and Franco Folies festivals, which can be a good thing. Otherwise, it's location is just OK, but it is right on the Metro line. Both times I stayed there, I booked through third party booking sites. Perhaps accordingly, I had odd rooms. The shower head and tap were in a weird spot and there was no minibar, which is always annoying (I'd like to at least have the option of using it if I want to).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: karl1967
Reviews.Content: Great location near Old Montreal and other popular areas like St. Catherine and St. Laurent Streets. Comfy and clean and often available on Priceline for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fall Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ttreadway
Reviews.Content: I have been a patron of the city of Montreal for many years and have stayed in lots of hotels. However, I must tell you this hotel was fantastic in location, service and amenities! The rooms were clean and comfortable. The service at the front desk, bellman, valet, conceirge, etc. were superb. The pool area is excellent with beautiful sliding doors, giving access to a pavillion with street views. The only complaint which is really not a biggie was there was no bar service until 5:00pm?! Just wanted to have a couple cocktails but ended up headed out on St. Catherine Street and hangin in the outdoor cafes. I highly recommend this safe(parking underneath the hotel), friendly and chic hotel to anyone familiar or unfamiliar with Montreal. Please feel free to email me if you have any other questions. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: vptrickster
Reviews.Content: Stayed there by myself for a marathon and got the executive package, which allowed me access to the concierge suite with free apps and private concierge. The private concierge wasn't great, as he wasn't around untill 1pm, but the free appetizers was nice Good location and friendly frontdesk. no official concierge, so if you have to ask for reccommendation you have to wait in front desk line which could be annoying if they were busy. Very close to good shopping, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions...”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: Although well situated in the city, this hotel is by no means perfect. If you get a good deal, though, go for it! Most noteworthy... SET UP - As you've probably read in other reviews, it's a bit of a pain in the neck to navigate this hotel, as you first have to take an elevator several floors to the lobby before then doing the same to get to your room. Unfortunately, the elevators are a bit schizophrenic. LOCATION - Right in the mix of things - a short walk here and a short walk there. Also situated above a mall (with a full grocery store!). FITNESS / RELAXATION - As part of an apparent renovation, they clearly paid attention to the addition of a decent workout room with ample equipment. Also, the pool and deck area were very enjoyable. Be sure to enjoy the sauna and steam area, too. ROOM - This is where things start to get a bit sad. Although recently renovated, it looked somewhat worked over - not bad by any means but certainly not what you might expect given a recent makeover. SERVICE - A spotty area as well. Check in was a bit of a mess with a line of people and a desk staff that seemed off their game - unable to deal well with the volume of people and a variety of issues. One evening, the hotel hosted a wedding reception with music that kept hotel guests awake until 2:00 AM. Staff/management was ill-equipped to deal with this sort of frustration from guests.

Reviews.Title: “it will do”
Reviews.Author: racecarracecar
Reviews.Content: location: it's a pretty far walk from old montreal, but it's walkable. with some connecting stops on the subway you can get to old montreal from the hotel to the champs-de-mars stop. the hotel is located about 2 blocks away from what i'd consider to be montreal's "red light district." it is located on st. catherine street and if you walk a couple of blocks (5-6) towards dairy queen you start to hit some decent shopping. Eating: The diner, Eggspectations, is right down stairs, they make reallly good french toast! and the hotel is located right above the Complex des jardin's food court. the hotel has a restaurant, aswell, but it was under renovations while i was there. hotel: small rooms, dimly lit, basic amenities, small bathroom, not impressed. wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: digitaldreams23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and it was a lovely hotel. We were asked if we'd like 2 double beds or a king bed, so we took the latter. The room was spacious and comfortable, though my partner had a stiff/sore neck from the pillows but I guess he could have brought his own. The staff are very helpful and will tell you where to go if you don't quite know, or how to get to where you do want to go (Maria was helpful and saved us a long walk because my partner was under the impression that it wasn't so far away but it was, and Olga recommended which streets to wander for some nice restaurants). The gentlemen at the parking are great too - very nice, courteous and willing to help out in any way that they can (regular parking is $19, but each time you take your car out you will have to pay again, so we went with valet parking, which is $26 a day). We were able to get internet, 2 hours for $5 (and there are various other options for other prices), but once we also took advantage of the Starbucks across the street, bought some coffees and used their wifi. Only complaint - the washroom. Very small but still, it was clean and everything (although not so much the tub) was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation of this nearly 35 year old hotel. . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This hotel started life as Le Meridien, and later had a Radisson flag on it, before the most recent renovation that sees the property managed by Hyatt. In the years since its opening just before the Olympics, its Complexe Desjardins location, across from Place des Arts, hasn't changed, but Montreal has gotten more interesting going eastward, so the hotel is more central than ever. . . Kudos to the owners and designers who carried out this renovation. Given the age of the hotel--a lot of Montreal was erected in the mid 60s to mid 70s, for the Expo 67 and 1976 Olympics, and not all has aged gracefully--the refurbishment was a near gut rehab. And a thorough one at that. . .new and fresh lobby, guest rooms, lounge areas, and fitness center. Rooms are not huge, but they are ample and airy. The original design of the building, sort of a checkerboard pattern, provides just half a window to the outside. Supposedly, the view I received, out over Place des Arts and a slice of Mount Royal, is a premium one with a surcharge--the front desk agent gave it to me as 1) I requested it, and 2) she was not sold out. Very nice of her, but the view would not be worth the $20 per night extra cost. Great Hyatt beds, in-room coffee, and brand new carpet are highlights. Odd that they did not install flat screen TVs given the newness of the reno effort. Bathrooms are well laidout, and more pleasant than their size would indicate. Great bumpy Portico soap and curved shower rods are nice touches, though the vanity has just one sink, and a small area at that. Interestingly, Priceline categorizes this hotel as a 3 1/2 star, while its freshness and amenities would be closer to 4 star in my book (especially given some of what Priceline does call 4 star). That rating accounts, in part, for the $63 US room rate bid that Priceline accepted--a steal for this hotel. It is to the hotel's credit that I was treated with VIP service, and upgraded even with this--some hotels treat you like the great unwashed if you are a Priceline purchaser. The hotel lobby is seven stories above the street, and the double elevator rides get a bit tedious--the trip to your room requires an elevator to the lobby, then a second set of elevators to get you through the guest room tower. The Complexe Desjardins/Place des Arts location puts guests within underground access to two Metro stations (with similar names, Place des Arts, and Place d'Armes), the Convention Center, and much of the rest of downtown Montreal's vast tunnel system. Complexe Desjardins, itself, is a large mall and office complex (the center court is one of the most voluminous retail spaces in the world. .) with a considerable food court at the lower level. Place des Arts, right across St. Catherine St. is Montreal's answer to Lincoln Center, with a number of performance spaces, and the hall for the Montreal Symphony. Chinatown is nearby, and the main downtown shopping stretch along St. Catherine is just a few blocks to the west of the hotel. St. Catherine going east, from about St. Urbain to St. Denis, is the closest thing downtown Montreal has to a red light district, and while it is not aggressively awful, it is not pretty, particularly at night. The gay Village starts just beyond St. Denis, about a 15 minute walk east. And north along St. Denis is the Quartier Latin, with countless cafes and restaurants spilling out onto the sidewalk. Visitors who take the train into Central Station have about a six block walk. Overall the Hyatt can be a great choice, particularly when Priceline bids in the $60-70 range are accepted. Even at full price, the location and stylish renovation make this a strong hotel to consider for a Montreal visit. Good things: Complete renovation of a 34 year old hotelâ€”stylish and comfortable update. Notably central locationâ€”within Complexe Desjardins for shopping and dining options, across from Place des Arts, and connected to underground city/convention centerâ€”covered access to two Metro stations. Brand new fitness facility and pool area, with sun deck, fitness center use free Great beds, new carpet, and numerous outletsâ€”nice Portico bath products, and curved shower rods. Solid serviceâ€”upgrade at front desk despite Priceline booking, waived two local callsâ€™ charge, responsive housekeeping staff. Free in-cup coffee maker (though include paper cupsâ€”mugs only doesnâ€™t cut it) Refrigerator, not mini bar, in room. Not good things: Not in the center of downtownâ€”five blocks from core. Neighborhood just to east of the hotel along St. Laurent kind of sketchy. Double elevatorâ€”ground floor to lobby, then lobby to guest room towerâ€”makes for longer time to room. As well, frequent elevator stops. Despite recent renovation, retained old style televisions. Charge for internet in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location... but not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Simply_Hunky
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for about $96 USD/night. I wouldn't pay much more than that however. Good... clean, great downtown location, comfortable beds, friendly staff. Bad... it's not 4 star as advertised. 3.5 sure. The rooms and bathrooms need a little updating. Hotel movie had background "static". Not great when you pay $12.99 for one. The real bad... the air conditioning. It was really warm in Montreal (above 30 degrees). The AC in the rooms couldn't keep up . While we had it on max, it was about 24 degrees in the room. They first came up... said it was broke... they'd send a repair person the next morning and if that didn't work, they'd change us to another two double room. And they sent a fan up. Next morning... nothing. We left for the day. Came back... called again... said they would call back in a few. No call. Third time he said he'd check into it. Nothing. Friendly but not very organized. Talking to other guests... we're thinking it wasn't broke and it just sucked to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: AMBLF
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights from August 8th to August 11th with my wife, 13 year old daughter and 8 year old daughter. The check-in was easy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We found the Hyatt to be reasonably priced and and wonderfully situated. You can walk to all the downtown attractions and Old Montreal. The subway is directly under the hotel and can take you anywhere you want to go. There are many coffee shops with excellent muffins and pastries in the food court in the mall underneath the Hyatt which is only an elevator ride away and very convenient when you are traveling with children. The indoor pool was wonderful. When they opened all the glass doors around the pool we got a beautiful view of the city from the pool area. As one reviewer stated, there could have been more chairs around the pool but if that's going to ruin your vacation then stay home. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “definitly not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoppertraveller
Reviews.Content: Not as good as the other Hyatts. Check in took forever. Valet parking was very slow. Rooms were clean but the bathroom had mold.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, on sale.... otherwise?”
Reviews.Author: Ttaylo3
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not meet the Hyatt standards. While the staff is nice, and the location is great, the hotel is run down. The common spaces and rooms are nicely furnished, but for a hotel that is supposed to be four star, it's not. Rooms need money spent to update them (i.e. flat screen t.v.s) It's difficult to get into the hotel (one elevator to the lobby, and then one to the rooms), but it's location makes it worth $100 a night, not much more. Having stayed at another Hyatt property this week, I was disappointed with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Connoisseur86
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Montreal for the Jazz Festival and Divers/Cite. I was looking for a hotel that was in center town and came across the Hyatt as being in a good location. This hotel is on the corner of Jeanne Mance and St Catherine St, right downtown. This offered excellent proximity to great shopping, dining, nightlife, the village is about a 15 min walk from here. The jazz festival was literally right out side the hotel. I had made a reservation for a Deluxe Room with a king size bed. When we arrived, they didn't have any available as the hotel as full, so we took a room with a double bed and an excellent view of St Catherine St and the Jazz Festival. The room was very nice and clean. The decore was modern and chic. The bathroom was a good size and very well lit. I was in room 922. The bed was very comfortable, and the double size wasn't an issue. Even with two grown men in the bed. The hotel staff were very courteous and polite and wanted to make sure that guests had the most pleasant stay and were willing to assist guests in finding attractions and dining options. This hotel also has easy acess to Vieux Montreal and the Metro. Parking at the Hyatt was quite expensive, however if you pack at the underground public parking (Desjardins), it;s not too bad...we arrived after 5pm and stayed a full 24 hours...parking came to $9.00CAD. They seemed to have a nice pool at this hotel as well, however i didn't have a chance to use it. Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: Msissmore
Reviews.Content: This hotel became a Hyatt in 2003, someone forgot to tell the management as it is being run like a youth hostile. I should have known that getting a rate of just over $100 was to good to be true. If you are not used to the excellent staff at a Hyatt you maybe ok. If you are, prepared for long line ups at the understaffed front desk, no served breakfast buffet only at $25, cant even get a muffin or a coffee unless you leave the hotel, or get the buffet. No restaurant open in the afternoon, no newspaper at the door, fitness center with machines from 2003. This place just feels cheap, not so much the facility as much as the policies and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, conviniently situated!”
Reviews.Author: JohannVienna
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel with hotwire.com and got a nice room with view over St. Catherines Avenue at a very reasonable rate. The room was comfortable, very clean and spacious. The hotel is situated within the Complex Desjardin adjacent to Place des Arts and St. Catherines Avenue in Downtown Montreal. On the downside is, that the room was very cold and the aircondition hardly to regulate. The doors seemed to be thin, so we were disturbed several time at night by noisy people on the floor. We were disturbed by the maid, although we had the "privacy please"-sign outside.

Reviews.Title: “Blah!”
Reviews.Author: Bose2
Reviews.Content: PROS; location, direct access to the metro and the Complexe Desjardins mall, stylish rooms. CONS: front desk staff (one of the worst I've seen in any hotel), cleanliness (cobwebs & spiders in the room, mold in the shower, dirty bathroom floor, dirty windows), no HDTV, A/C not working accordingly in the room, parking inconvenient and expensive, no business centre (closed because of a fire, six months ago...) Hyatt is not going to steal me away from Starwood and Marriott with this one! Very disappointed once again, this is not my first stay here and had the same staff & cleanliness issues the last time around. No more Hyatt Regency Montreal for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Disappointing Pool”
Reviews.Author: anotherfussytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night for a quick romantic get away. This hotel is in a great location, and is only a five minute walk to Old Town Montreal. Overall the room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The air condition however was very loud and rattled. The biggest disappointment was the pool. After a 4 hour drive, and a frustrating hour wait to get through customs, we were really looking forward to just lounging by the pool for a couple of hours. While the pool was equipped with fabulous cushioned lounge chairs, I counted only a handful of chairs (maybe 7 or 8) and there was no seating available. I spoke to the pool attendent about the problem, and she simply shrugged her shoulders. Exacerbated, we had no choice but to nap in our room. (That, I could have done at home.) I expect much more from the amenities and services from this class of hotel and will think twice before staying again.

Reviews.Title: “A++ hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: We had first made reservations with Hyatt at $229/night for the Jazz Fest weekend. Ended up 'naming your own price' on Priceline and got 2 rooms for $86/night. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor, view was of a side street. Hyatt was the epi-center of the festival, and we couldn't have been luckier! Although the rooms were standard, the hotel staff and it's gathering spaces made up for the standard rooms. Wonderful outdoor and indoor common areas, nice indoor pool which opens onto a sundeck. Indoor, outdoor bars, great bar menu. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was worth it. We were not rushed or hurried through our breakfast and it was great to sit, relax and enjoy the many, many offerings on their 'buffet'. Thank you Jose for your attentiveness to us! The hotel is adjacent to a mall, and the mall has every type of shop you'll need, a grocery store, liquor store(liquor stores are government run so all prices at all stores are the same), salon, clothing, shoes...everything! We bought some great snacks at the IGA and took advantage of the outdoor space which overlooked the jazz fest. Took a walk into Old Montreal on Saturday...highly recommended. The Basilique Notre-Dame de Montreal is a breath-taking must see. We stopped off at les 3 Brasseurs for a beer tasting and bar snacks. Many local shops line the streets and it makes for a great afternoon activity. Back at the hotel we ventured to the spa/steam/sauna....you could get lost trying to find them, but they are worth the venture. Spa services such as facials and massages must be booked through the concierge, there are no technicians on site and you will need an advanced appointment. We had all good intentions of going to a fabulous restaurant but heavy rains and thunder storms made us re-think our plans and we decided to stay put, order pizza and talk the night away. Our floor was full, but oddly, we never heard any outside noises, with the exception of doors closing, it was a quiet floor. There was no concierge on site--but we have to give a huge shout out to Thomas, bell-hop extraordinaire! He took the time to search out places to eat and had them ready for us when we returned later that day. Valerie, front-desk superstar worked her magic and found 2 rooms on the same floor for us, throughout our stay, she took the time to say hello, and remembered who we were, a nice personal touch. Maria was also extremely helpful if and when Valerie was busy. Pietro who helped us with our bags, made sure we knew how everything worked in the room. Heather, the bartender told us many spots to visit while we were in her town. Granted, our stay was perfect because of those that were around us. Thank you to the city of Montreal, your people are so friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Variable service”
Reviews.Author: HoserEh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little beat up and getting dingy for a Hyatt. But the biggest problem I had was with the service. First let me say that I rarely complain and am a pretty easy traveler. But multiple times I had issues, mostly small annoyances, with the service that left a bad taste... For example, the in room movie system was giving me some sort of fault when I tried to order one of their (very expensive) movies. After calling the front desk and waiting a day for it to be fixed, I called down again. The guy at the desk passed me to a "help number" that turned out to be the service number the hotel is supposed to call to get their system fixed. Given it was late on a Sunday, he had to have known the help line would not be open. It was pretty clear he just wanted me out of my hair - bloody pain in the ^&# American. There were a couple other instances where I thought they were more rude then they needed to be. Some of my colleagues at this conference stayed at the other near by hotels had said they had very good experiences. The convention center is a great place for a conference!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovet2travel57
Reviews.Content: #1 You have to stand on one very LONG line with everyone in the hotel who is checking in/checking out/needs directions or a taxi etc. #2 Our reservations specified one room, three people. We were assigned a single room with one bed. A trip back downstairs, another long wait on a long line, and we were re-assigned a double room with two beds. #3 During our 3 night stay the room was attended to between 4 pm and 6pm. The beds were made, but the room was not vacuumed or dusted. #4 The bathroom towels were changed but the bathroom was never cleaned. We've had better service in a Motel 6!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location....Good Rate......One Bad night....Overall a Good place”
Reviews.Author: bakeralvin
Reviews.Content: We stayed june 19th to 22nd for a couples get away. We got a good rate through Priceline. Nice Pool, friendly staff (although we never did see a conceierge...) and a great location. Walking distance to a lot of neat sites. The only bad thing was there was a huge corporate function on the Friday night that kept us awake and also noise in the hallway from grad kids...Saturday and Sunday were quiet...unfortunately management did nothing about the noise when we called...our room was good and we did like the hotel. One tip...try the new Bixi bicycle rental on the streets from the city of Montreal... a real neat way to get around...only $5 for a 24hr rental...

Reviews.Title: “had a nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: gupta_anilk
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hyatt, Montreal was just splendid. Especially when you are out there on vacation with kids and that too when it is raining outside, you have to spen your time indoors. Our experience in Hyatt was very good. The swimming pool, the restaurants, children enjoyed each and evry bit of their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Please Do Not Hesitate to stay here!!! take my word”
Reviews.Author: martinsby
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days trip in montreal, was great! The trip was wonderful plus our stay at the Hyatt problem free. from checked in to checked out everything was smooth! the room was clean and beds was comfy. We left our luggages at the concierge after checked out since we need to do some shopping before our 4 pm train back to Toronto, and it wasnt a problem at all, the staff was very friendly. I am not really a complaint kinda person but i can tell that if i do ask for something they would do their best coz i seen some ppl was helped with their problems. Please pls pls do not hesitate to stay here, despite this Hotel rank at 50ish! If you do get ur hotel room from Priceline, then you got a GREAT deal. If not u still will be happy staying here. Hotel is 6 block away from Via Train station, China town with TONS of great foods are 2 block away fr the hotel. St Catharine is next block, and the Gay village are just 5 blocks away if you come to montreal for nite that. The hotel has some nice facilities but I only use the Gym, and it is nice and open 24 hrs! They have a decent size indoor pool. If you want a good stay without spending lots of money for hotel room stay here. But if you are a High Demanded Fancy people, stay somewhere else and spend 300 or more per nite coz you will end up complaning and left a NEGATIVE comments that wont help travellers. Hope this help, again Stay here and enjoy your Montreal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Reluctant 4 circle review, probably more like 3.5”
Reviews.Author: atourist00
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel... it's listed as 4* given its amenities, but I think location and things around it really boost the hotel. For example, there's a Starbucks, Eggspectation, and a whole shopping center close by. So you really have a lot of options for restaurants, shopping, late night bites, etc. no matter the time. I don't think all areas of Montreal enjoy this. Also, it's close (5-10 min walk) to both major lines of the metro. Rooms are relatively big, pretty standard for "business" hotels, and the included toiletries are okay. Things I didn't like = I guess this is a trend in Canada hotels, but there was no safe in the room, no minibar (at least there was an ice machine on the floor). The lobby and entrance has got to be one of the dumbest and most inconvenient designs I have ever seen. It was definitely "noisier" and not as professional as other hotels (yappy cleaning ladies, etc.) The bar was consistently empty, and the front desk was sparsely staffed... usually there was a line. No free internet anywhere but luckily I leeched off an open connection that only happened to work in my room and with my laptop turned a particular way... pretty funny (writing the review right now). But I guess most "chain" hotels never give away Internet, but at least some people have free wi-fi in the lobby. The Hyatt had an open terminal in the lobby for general use but it was constantly mobbed. So overall, this was a good hotel, run-of-the-mill business class, all the amenities, no major complaints but I certainly wouldn't pay full or rack rates. The location really makes the overall experience really pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “No free internet in rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: vancitystan
Reviews.Content: Point form: Good location. Great view from room 412 facing the plaza across the street. Clean rooms. Great beds. Clean pool and gym. Liked the steam room. It is shared between guys and girls. Walking distance to old Montreal (20 minutes). Payed $92/night on Hotwire. For that price it was a bargain. --- Tiny bathrooms. Room doors slam shut and that could wake you up at night if people around you get back to their rooms late. No jacuzzi!! No free internet in rooms!! In fact it is over priced at close to $20 per day!!! Front desk gets really busy during day if you need to talk to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: MurphyCPCU
Reviews.Content: We were looking for convenience with close proximity to Montreal attractions. For that purpose it was very good. There is an IGA store on the same block with shopping and access to decent restaurants on the same block. Access to Cresent Street area, Old Montreal and the Latin Quarter all walkable. The hotel is a bit tired. Service at the desk and pool were good. Our room was not cleaned on the second day. All in all it served it's purpose. I would not be happy paying top dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: summafunmum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bargain at $50US from Priceline.com, rated at 3 1/2 stars. We booked two rooms for the May long weekend. After reading other recommendations we opted for "self parking" which was $9 per day in the mall parkade, directly below the hotel. (Be sure you tell the valet at the hotel entrance that you are self-parking as he will not mention that option. They would prefer that you pay their $26 rate for valet instead.) After making the reservation through Priceline, I contacted the hotel directly to request two side-by-side rooms, as well as two double beds in each. No problem. The hotel itself is a bit confusing as the lobby is on the 6th floor of the building. It is a nice property--prime location on the best shopping street in Montreal. Chinatown is a 5 min. walk, the Old City is 10 min. It seems like the hotel has had a recent upgrade. Decor is sleek and contemporary. Our room was spotless with super-comfy beds, soft sheets and down blankets. Although the bathroom was small, it had lovely marble tile floors and tub surround and a black granite vanity top. There was also a little bar counter area in the room--very convenient for preparing coffee, drinks, snacks, etc. Having the mall downstairs was very convenient as there is a grocery and liquor store as well as several food outlets. The pool area is one of the best things about this hotel, especially if you have kids. The pool is huge, by hotel standards, with a nice sauna and steam room and spa-like shower and change rooms. My only complaint about this property is that it feels very sterile and impersonal. More like checking into an office building than a hotel. I think it has to do with a shortage of staff. You rarely see anyone around. Check in/check out was very slow and our room wasn't ready until 5pm...but for the price we got through Priceline, this hotel was an amazing deal. I would recommend it highly and definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good...not Great”
Reviews.Author: Rockemsockemrobot
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal a few times a year and this was my 1st stay at the Hyatt. Quickly... The Good. 1. Location, near fun part of town, easy to walk around; 2. The food in the Regency Club was good (see the bad regarding Regency Club below); 3. The staff was kind and professional. Ivan in Regency Club was very nice. The Bad. 1. Executive Club room was very average and bathroom was small and substandard; 2. Alcoholic drinks are not included in price during happy hour at Regency Club, so what is the point of drinking in Regency Club...one can get a greater selection by ordering at the bar and bringing the drinks into the Regency Club for the snacks; 3. No concierge, so questions have to be posed to the front desk which can get congested. Overall it is fine, but there are better choices in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy dark rooms that were depressing”
Reviews.Author: kimmoranj
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel because the room was depressing, dark, and needed re-modeling desperately. I booked through the internet and got a pretty good deal on the room but once I saw the place, I was disappointed. The hotel should really invest some capital into new floors, lamps, and walls. With a little money, the place could be wonderful because the location is pretty central. However, my husband and I did enjoy the swimming pool, and during our two night stay, the maid service was pretty satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: travbuddy_28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly standard as others have said. I thought the service in the restaurant was great (and decent food, tapas style and bar style), the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful in orienting us to the city, and the location is very convenient. Temperature control is an issue (no thermostats) and the gym is excruciatingly hot. High speed interent is pricey. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service, but good rooms”
Reviews.Author: FreqentFlyer20
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fine (if a bit cold, with no way to adjust the temp upwards - could just be me, but I like it a few degrees warmer), and the beds are very comfortable. However, call the front desk if you like to hear the sound of a phone ringing...and ringing...with no one answering. If you call room service you get a lovely voice message saying their hours and if you'd like to leave a message. No actual room service will speak with you or take an order (they apparently don't listen to the voice mail). They have an "eConcierge" if you want to make a reservation for the hotel restaurant, but there's no actual concierge. comfy rooms, but otherwise a 2-star hotel. Try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DingerDow
Reviews.Content: I travelled up to Montreal for a one night stay, to see a hockey game at the Bell Centre. The hotel is in a great location downtown, 10 min walk to the Bell Centre, directly across the street from the art museum, and the Theatre Maisonneuve. The hotel rooms are very standard, but clean, and bed 's are very comfortable! Great deal!! only paid $50US on priceline.com

Reviews.Title: “4-Star....questionable”
Reviews.Author: ande0032
Reviews.Content: CONS: front desk staff rude; dark hallways; no bar fridge; check-in time can vary greatly...so don't expect an earlier one! The elevators & the layout of this hotel is the most problematic. There are 4 very s-l-o-w elevators to go to the rooms; then another s-l-o-w 2 elevators to go to the parking area/taxi stand. We didn't eat in the hotel - so I have no idea about the restaurants. SAQ located in Desjardins Complex which is connected to the Hyatt - however you need to take yet ANOTHER s-l-o-w elevator to get to it. PROS: Clean rooms; clean hotel; comfy beds; Location is fantastic - about 7-9(?) blocks north of old Montreal; about 7-10 (?) blocks west of Rue St-Denis and about 5 blocks east of Rue Ste-Catherine. The shopping on Rue Ste-Catherine is AMAZING! Quick note - if walking to Rue St-Denis on Rue Ste-Catherine be aware of several 'adult entertainment' shops....may not be the best route for kiddies or questionable tweens!

Reviews.Title: “OK value, good location, chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: malibert
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel for a two night stay. Very comfortable bed and pretty spacious room with a good view of the city. The location is very central to downtown and the Metro, and its connected to the Desjardins Center and the underground city. Upon reading reviews we parked at the Desjardins Center and saved alot of money. Plus, we arrived at 11pm on a Friday night to an unattended valet desk... I was tired and would have just paid for valet, but that wasn't really an option. Plus I realized the valets would just put the car in the Desjardins garage anyway (its literally right next door, sharing the same driveway). So then we tried to find our way to reception from the garage... its on the 6th floor - I don't think the hotel website ever told me that. Reception wasn't that warm or friendly, but the room service staff was very nice. Fitness room was better than average and the pool was very popular. Didn't try any of the hotel bars/restaurants b/c there are alot of options in Montreal. There is also a ton of roadwork going on in the area - this made driving around the hotel a little frustrating, but once you're in its not noisy or anything like that. Depending on the rate I may stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard issue hotel... very nice”
Reviews.Author: chetmix
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal for this hotel on Hotwire - $70! Hotel rooms were stylish and clean, staff were friendly. Didn't really get to make good use of the facilities but they seemed good. Two areas for improvement - hallways were extremely dim - I always got the sense that someone would jump out of a dark corner! Also, the hot water in our room didn't seem to be working all so well - you had to turn the temperature to the maximum heat in order to get warm water. Otherwise, well recommended - right across from Place Des Arts Metro and not too far from the Place D'Armes metro.

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: snasp
Reviews.Content: Situated on top of a shopping concourse (not a cheesy mall) with lots of great options for food, groceries and drinks. Convenient location for easy access to all areas of interest in Montreal. Downtown, Plateau, Village and Old Montreal all within walking distance (weather permitting) or cheap cab ride. Rooms large and comfortable. Lacking only two things for my money - an in-room fridge and flat panel TV. Otherwise great stay, comfortable, convenient. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: TakeOffEh2
Reviews.Content: I felt a little compelled to write a review on this one because I was a little skeptical. Other reviews seems very hit or miss. I agree entirely with the previous review. The lobby is nice, pool area is great, the restaurant looked nice (but I didn't eat there). Service was fine as well. For us, what made the trip was that it was attached to the mall. I didn't think this was too big of a 'perk', until I found out that I just had to go down the escalator for a great lunch and breakfast selection, late night treats at the grocery store, and a nice bottle of wine from the SAQ (Quebec's liquor store). Plus travelling with a young child, he was able to run around the mall fountain @ 7:30 am without going outside. Of course the location is very central, right on Ste. Caterine and about a 10 minute walk from Old Montreal. Now for the actual rooms. I thought they were fine. A closer look and there is definately some wear, but nothing to be concerned about. As with the previous review, mine is a little skewed because of the great rate I received, but a solid choice none the less..

Reviews.Title: “It is a business hotel - nothing fancy, nothing terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Greenblat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just a few minutes from downtown, Chinatown old Montreal. The hotel looks like it had a renovation 5+ years ago. The lobby area is well decorated and pleasant. The rooms themselves were also renovated, although it doesn't look like they put much money into them just a refreshing. The hotel itself looks like a large block of concrete. While I donâ€™t think it will any architectural awards, it is not as ugly from the outside as some previous posts have suggested. The hotel sits above a large shopping mall (and has direct access without having to go outside). This is very convenient. There is a large food court, wine store and an IGA supermarket (as well as the usual mall brands). My review is in part influenced by the fact that I got a very, very cheap rate on Hotwire for this hotel (a fraction of the advertised rate). If I had to pay full rates for this hotel I would have shopped around to see if I could find a better hotel for the same money. The bottom line is this: this is a business hotel. You wouldnâ€™t stay here if you were looking for an amazing service experience (try the W hotel or Intercontinental instead). However, if you are looking for a business hotel which has what you need and wont break the bank, this is a good candidate.

Reviews.Title: “good quality, sensible city hotel - no medals, no brickbats”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: Architecturally this is horrible - a raw concrete block sitting over a shopping mall, with the lobby an elevator away from street and taxi level. But that doesn't matter too much once you're inside, looking out! Service is ok. Check in was quick tho' the girl didn't know the answers to most of my questions and had to refer to her colleagues. Check out was slow as there was a queue of guests and not enough staff. Room service was quick and efficient (and the food was good!). The bellboy was slow to get my stored bags as I left but quick to get a cab. Coffee service in the lobby was willing and friendly. The room's a typical Hyatt room, the right size, comfortable bed, good bath, tea/coffee in the room. The internet worked well (I suspect it's, as usual for a Hyatt, expensive, but I had a internet-included rate). Breakfast was good, plenty of choice, and good quality. I'd picked this hotel as it had an indoor pool that was reputed to be (just) long enough to swim laps. However at 6pm on a Sunday it was already shut for the day, and didn't open till late morning. As a business traveller with meetings all day this meant that I couldn't use it. Very frustrating. There's a small gym (a bit too much equipment in too small a space). So this is an efficient place to stay if you've meetings in this part of Montreal, but you wouldn't stay here for a relaxed weekend, or an extended period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: devincente
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency Montreal We choose this hotel because of the brand. Booked 2 King rooms for a week-end for family travelling from Europe. What a nightmare when we got to the rooms, it wasn't King bedrooms. We have to insist before the not-too-friendly staff eventually said I ahve 2 King rooms for you. It wasn't King, rooms were smelly, paint in bathroom was awful... Nevere saw this before. 5-year old daughter said: "This is worst than the hotels we've been to in the summer". We were in Montreal, NYC, ... always 4+ stars Be careful with this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location but guest rooms need work!”
Reviews.Author: WilmaKelowna_BC
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and two young kids stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in February. The lobby is nice, staff friendly and the hotel is in a great location with access to a mall via the hotel elevators. The negatives were the guest rooms as the bathrooms needed updating ie. the shower. I did not think they were up to Hyatt standards. The elevators were not cleaned regularly. The hotel restaurant is not open for dinnner which made it difficult with two young kids as the mall downstairs shut around 6pm during the week. On the positive side, the pool is great! Have to be honest though, upon entering the guest room, my husband and daughter insisted they could not stay in such a room however did adapt after a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: SophMTL7
Reviews.Content: We were able to book this hotel for a bit less than 100$ CAD (all in) with Priceline. The service staff were very friendly and accommodating for our early check-in. The room was clean, bed super comfortable, and the shower top notch! It's a great location and a short walk to key areas. We parked at the shopping mall (complexe Desjardins) for 9$. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to MTL, and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripchick29
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel in early January 2009. I booked through Hotwire at $75/night. The room was nothing special. It had a king size bed, older TV, sparse decor. It was a bit of a let down considering it was a Hyatt. The main problem in the room was the shower. The water temperature constantly changed from hot to freezing despite attempts to adjust accordingly. The tub was also a disappoinment, narrow and shallow, like an apartment tub. The restaurant was not open for dinner during the time we were there. There is some food available in the lounge adjacent to the lobby. Parking is $19/day with no in-out privileges or $26/day valet with in-out privileges. Wireless internet is available at $12.95/day. On the plus side, this hotel offered excellent service. The staff were very willing to please and efficient. There is a beautiful pool area and gym. The location is fantastic. It is adjoined to a mall with easy access to the Metro and the underground network of tunnels, especially nice when it's freezing cold outside.
